Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Brendan R
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are simple, but good enough for people like us who don't spend much time ACTUALLY in the room! There's a lot to see and do in Istanbul, you need to get out of your room to do it all! Fortunately, most of the BEST places to see are in walking distance from this hotel. The breakfast was always clean and decent. Nice local style - bread, cheese, pomegranate juice, rich tea, etc. The neighborhood is full of cafes, bars, bistros and you'll never be hungry or bored in this area! You'll find hundreds of places to stay in this tourist zone, and they're all similar. However the nice guy working at the desk of this place makes it a bit special. He got us a great deal on a Bosporus boat tour and gave us good advice about what to go see. We felt we were treated like friends, and it made us love Turkey. I'll hopefully re-visit, and I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a simple, convenient place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain, good location”
Reviews.Author: shuchigo
Reviews.Content: Located in Sultanahmet, this hotel is a quick walk away from most major attractions. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast spread, though not expansive, was served at the terrace restaurant overlooking the sea; which was a big plus. The room was basic, but clean, warm and cosy. Our room was on the top floor, next to the restaurant, so we could just walk out on the terrace when we felt like, which was great. There was no view directly from the room, though. Overall, a great bargain in terms of comfort, accommodation, location and food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FFA2010
Reviews.Content: We statyed at this wonderful small hotel during our recent trip to Istanbul. It was a nice and very clean hotel with good service and helpful staff. It located in a safe area where we did not worry about waking even late at night. You can see the see the Sea of Marmara from the terrace where the breakfast room is located. The Blue mosque, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Archaelogical Museum, Sulamaniyae Mosque, Bascilica Cistern and the ferry for the Bosphorus are within easy walking distance or a short tram car ride away. The same tram car can take you to Taksim Square which is the heart of modern Istanbul. What more can you ask for or need? We recommend it unconditionally.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted-bargain, location, clean, nice simple interiors”
Reviews.Author: Buffwolf
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and a great bargain. It was grey and overcast when we were there, but breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Bosporous - Crossroads of history, is a great amenity. Great location (yes it is tourist-ville, but not in an annoying way, and I am easily annoyed by such things). Easy walk to the metro (using this to get to the airport is worth the savings - it is a 21st century system, made me sad to return to the squeaky rattling charm of Boston's T). You can linger among the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, etc, after dark when they are at their aesthetic best, and virtually crowd free. Just be prepared, there is a morning prayer megaphone right outside the upper floor windows, but it reminds you that you are out of your element which is why we travel (at least us). helpful staff, too.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the dungeon”
Reviews.Author: Lindy E
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April 10 and booked 3 months in advance specifically to request a room with a view. I was given a room in the basement at the back of the building, mostly below ground level with a strip of window at the top of the wall, with a view of peoples feet passing by. They could also easily see in. The wall was badly affected with rising damp.A really revolting room! Breakfast room at top was pleasant with beautiful views. As it's not possible to book a nice room I would not stay here again. Lindy E Aust.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Sabatical14
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever review for Trip Advisor. We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of December and were very pleased with the location. We had a large double room on the top floor, with views of the Bosporus. There is no lift, but the stairs were no problem for us & the staff brought our cases up to the room. The breakfast was excellent value and served just next door to our bedroom. We were made to feel welcome, slept very well - although all visitors should be aware that wherever you stay you will be woken up by the 'Call to Prayer' so take some earplugs. I am reluctant to say anything negative about this hotel, other than it can be a little tricky to find when you first arrive. An excellent value for money hotel and one that we have recommended to many friends.

Reviews.Title: “Right for the likes of us”
Reviews.Author: nworbd
Reviews.Content: The dÃ©cor is tacky and wi-fiâ€™s provided only in the tiny lobby, but comfortable beds and an excellent rooftop breakfast make the Peninsula a good budget choice in the generally pricy enclave between the Hagia Sophia and the Bosphorus shore. We paid TL100 per night for a double.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Julia F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Peninsula in November for a couple of days. The location is great, as it is only a short walking distance to a lot of main tourist attractions on the European side. The only downside is, that there are many mosques very close by... and call for prayer quite early in the morning! The staff was very friendly and helpful (especially Beris) ; the room was small but cute and very clean! They serve you a small breakfast and real turkish tea in the morning, and believe me that's all you need, too many delicious things to try when you walk around Istanbul- you don't want to go with a full stomach! If I visit Istanbul again, Hotel Peninsula will be my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !”
Reviews.Author: Ethan J
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really amazing. Located blocks from some of the most famous sights in Istanbul, this hotel maintains a relaxed environment with clean and comfortable rooms with excellent English speaking staff who was very friendly and competent. The hotel offers a very nice roof terrace with great view over the Bosphorus. There they serve a very good breakfast. You can also sit there and enjoy a glass of wine in the night after an eventful day you spent in discovering Istanbul. I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends and if ever I get the chance

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; Great staff”
Reviews.Author: mrmtrock
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in staying at a hotel in the center of everything Istanbul has to offer, consider this lovely boutique hotel with a wonderful front desk staff. We felt the value was very good and the room comfortable. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TJMMJT
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an ideal location for visiting Istanbul. The hotel is a short walking distance, along pleasant streets, to the metro and main attractions. The area around the hotel is very quiet but contains several restaurants and shops (an even a market which is great for buying large jugs of water).

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: Regal_Ali
Reviews.Content: I will highly recommend this hotel. Located conveniently to major attractions in Istanbul. The room was clean and cosy. It's a 4 storey hotel. For those with problems climbing stairs, request for rooms at the lower floors although the breakfast is at the terrace on the 4th floor. However, the rooms on the top floor have view of the sea. Great variety of bfast. All of the staffs were also very friendly esp Rohat. I would say this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, value price”
Reviews.Author: Bikergrrls
Reviews.Content: Hotel Peninsula is a good value option, within walking distance to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkai, Cisterns, and the Archeological Museum. The employees are friendly. As I was staying for two nights before flying back to the States, the owner provided me with directions to some sites that were off the beaten track (partially because one museum, the Panorama 1453 is too new to be in guidebooks). The breakfasts were hearty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Peninsula and had a great time. They serve a wonderful breakfast and have very kind and helpful staff. The rooms are very clean and quiet and the terrace is nice. We were within walking distance to everything we needed, including a lot of great restaurants. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: stayed here with the wife for three nights and it was clean and quiet with fantastic views from the terrace. Breakfast was good and set you up for a days sightseeing for which you didn't have to go far, the hotel being 3 minutes from the Blue Mosque (and thats real time not Turkish time). Staff are great, organised taxis, gave us maps, showed us how to use the safes etc etc so, all in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: IntentToTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Peninsula in July 2009 when visiting Istanbul for about a week at the end of a month-long stay in Turkey. This hotel was perfect for our needs. It was clean, quiet, in a safe area, and within easy walking distance to excellent restaurants and all of the tourist attractions. The staff were friendly but pushed a little too hard trying to get us to buy tourist packages through them rather than independently. They put on a very nice breakfast with an excellent rooftop terrace with an amazing view of the city. Excellent value. I would not hesitate to stay here again and I frequently recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure to Stay at this Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mozaik-bahce
Reviews.Content: I regularly visit Istanbul and love to stay at the Peninsula Hotel; perfectly located in the heart of Sultanahmet and within walking distance of many of the main tourist attractions: the Blue Mosque, TopkapÄ± Palace, Aya Sofya the Grand Bazaar. If you donâ€™t want to venture far in the evening there are many local restaurants and bars to choose from on the lively street just a moments walk from the Hotel Peninsula. The Peninsula is very clean with whiter than white duvet and pillow covers that feels as soft as silk, endless hot water from powerful showers and the traditional Turkish buffet breakfast is plentiful and accompanied by fresh crispy bread and homemade jams, yoghurt and cakes. Breakfast is taken on a two tier roof top terrace with sea views; there is also an enclosed seating area. Itâ€™s a favourite with travelers from around the globe so there is always interesting groups of people to chat with over breakfast. Prices include breakfast and are per room and extremely reasonable for such a popular and lively area of Sultanahmet. The owner Huseyin and the friendly staff are always available to help and advise as required.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Gopal-Venkat
Reviews.Content: Booking online is easy with Rohat & Baris answering e-mails promptly. The place is centrally located within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, TopKapi Palace and Basilica Cisterns. Great views from the Rooftop terrace. Excellent and FREE Wi-fi. At 40 Euros a night it is a bargain. I am glad I stayed here and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: mrsniccooper
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the Peninsular from the moment I made my initial e-mail enquiry as I had such a speedy and efficient response. When I then booked, we were offered very reasonable airport transfers and we decided to take them up on this as it was cost effective being 4 of us. We arrived late in the evening and I wanted to get to the hotel as fast as possible and was a little daunted by the choice in Public Transport. From landing, we were checked in at the hotel within the hour! The hotel was the perfect location for us. The main sights we wanted to see all within easy walking distance. A fantastic choice of eateries on the doorstep and you are slightly set back from the main drag so there is no noise from the street. The rooms are more than adequate. Comfortable beds with clean, good quality linens. Our bathroom was spotless and modern and we had a plentiful supply of Hot Water on demand. Breakfast was the usual continental style but it was very tasty, filling and the coffee, bread and juice were all fresh (that's a first for me in a Turkish hotel!) I also liked the fact that it was served from 8-11 giving guests plenty of time. The hotel had a lovely atmosphere and I liked the fact that everybody spoke to each other and shared experiences. There were families, couples and backpackers. English, French, Spanish and American. Rohat and the rest of the hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. We found Rohat's local knowledge invaluable and he gave us a great deal on excursions too. We couldn't have chosen better and I had looked at more expensive hotels but on reflection, I'm glad I didn't book any of those as for what we had here, I don't know what I would have got anywhere else for the extra money and I'm glad I saved that cash for my shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nick B
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay. Clean rooms. Hot water. Nice views. Small room but that makes it cosier. Very pleased overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good option at the Sultanhamet area”
Reviews.Author: travelzoop
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is situated in a quiet street but very close to the restaurants and bars of the Sultanhamet area. Rooms are large and quiet, at least the ones on the rear part of the hotel, very well furnished and have a clean and spacious bathroom. The hotel has a small roof where breakfast is served and from where you have a nice wiew of the Marmara sea, Santa Sofia and the Blue Mosque. We stayed in October so we could not enjoy the roof very much because of the cold wind of the season but they have hammocks for warmer days. The front desk guy was very helpful and patient giving us answers to all our questions. The breackfast is a little poor for what you pay for the night. I think they should include more salty options an do a better job with the presentation. I will recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a quiet and convenient location of the main tourist attracctions of Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with super friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: jessica1013
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a fantastic place to stay in Istanbul... excellent location near the Topaki Palace, Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque... the staff was very helpful and really fun to talk to... good price... clean rooms... yummy breakfast. We loved our stay at the Hotel Peninsula!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Katerina V
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in quiet street in Sultanahmet. The staff is very nice and helpful. Great breakfast on the rooftop terrace with amazing view on old city and see. The rooms are clean and bed comfortable. Very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Pat G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value, clean and conveniently located to historic areas of the city. Great breakfast, served on the rooftop terrace with a wonderful view. The friendly and helpful staff made sure that our group didn't miss any opportunities to enjoy the city. I will recommend this hotel to our friends, and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great views”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights with breakfast included in the rate, the very clean room had ensuite with great views over the sea of Marmara. Location was great close to everything,from the roof top a home cooked breakfast was served with delightful views of the Blue mosque and Aya Sofya on one side and sea of Marmara on the other, could not ask for better. Staff were friendly and helpful.Finding this hotel can be hard tell the taxi driver its near the Four Seasons hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overdue review - fantastic location, great value for money and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Aloa_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a quiet dead-end street in Sultanahmet with some great restaurants and shops around the corner. Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and all other Sultanahmet attractions (as well as tram station and taxi stand) are located within a short walking distance. The English speaking staff was very friendly and competent. As the triple room was not available the staff offered the more expensive Family Room for the same price. The room was very clean and although located in the basement it was bright and spacious. The hotel offers a very nice roof terrace with great view over the Bosphorus. There they serve a very good breakfast. You can also sit there and enjoy a glass of vine in the night after an eventful day you spent whit discovering Istanbul. I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends and if ever I get the chance to go back to Istanbul, I would definitely stay at Peninsula Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: algriff71
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Peninsula was fantastic. The rooms were clean, the location was perfect, and the staff was as nice as could be. Enjoy the view from the roof top terrace at sunset. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Janie
Reviews.Content: The best location and staff you could ask for makes the clean and comfortable rooms seem better than they are. Very friendly breakfast service. Ok. The muezin next door elevates you to the ceiling at sunrise. Part of the charm??

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: WalkingPilgrim
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the cleanliness of the hotel, the location, and the responsive helpfulness of the staff. We stayed for a total of 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous roof terrace view”
Reviews.Author: Trev0rAlis0n
Reviews.Content: We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Istanbul at the Hotel Peninsula. No problem accommodating our 5 children aged 13-20! Perfect location, good breakfast, breathtaking view from roof terrace & very friendly & helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “I can recommend”
Reviews.Author: Heli425
Reviews.Content: Good location, very friendly staff. Rooms clean and good service! I can definitely recommend to everyone. We are going to go to Istanbul again and definitely stay in this place again! Special thanks to Rohatille!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: bebohuevo
Reviews.Content: My wife and 10 month old daughter had great experience in this hotel. No surprises. The hotel/room was very clean, the location is exceptional with access to restaurants and the main sites within a 3 minute walk. The price based on location is excellent. Book ahead as some backpackers just show up and had to be referred to a sister location. The staff is very friendly and is always available to answer questions any tourist may have.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Matt D
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our five night stay at Peninsula. Very helpful staff, tidy rooms and excellent breakfast which is included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, best option in Istanbul for affordable traveling”
Reviews.Author: AJB55
Reviews.Content: Located blocks from some of the most famous sights in Istanbul, this hotel maintains a relaxed environment with clean, and comfortable rooms. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly, and being in a foreign country, made us feel at ease about getting around town. The best feature was the roof terrace where breakfast was served. Wonderful views of the city and on a higher tier hammocks were strung, where after long days of seeing the sights I was able easily relax with my book.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful, cozy place to stay--we hope to go back some day!”
Reviews.Author: jillbartelt
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Peninsula and would love to go back if we're lucky enough to get back to Istanbul some day. The rooms were clean, comfortable, quiet, and pretty. I can say this with authority because we stayed in three different ones. First, on the main floor--I would gladly have stayed in this room, but on our second room we were moved to the top floor, which was even nicer. This room had beautiful views of Istanbul's Sultanahmet area and the Bosphorus strait--AND, it was adjacent to the breakfast area. This was a plus, as breakfast was delicious (and included with the price of the room). We loved eating it up on the terrace, outside with more wonderful views of the city. We traveled around Turkey for a week and came back to Istanbul at the end of our trip and had yet another room--not the "penthouse" this time but a room on the street side, second floor. This room had the benefit of being extremely cool--we never needed the AC, which is incredible for Istanbul in July. Everyone who worked at the hotel was extremely helpful and kind--a number of the workers speak excellent English (and also correspond over email in English). This isn't necessary for a hotel stay, but it's helpful. The Peninsula Hotel is also close to many of Istanbul's attractions--the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, bazaars, archaeology museum, Topkapi Palace, and Galata Tower (Beyoglu area) were all within walking distance for us. The hotel is rather small, so not appropriate for large tour groups, but for couples, families, or small groups it is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “awsome place !!”
Reviews.Author: zekom
Reviews.Content: this hotel was really amazing..comfortable rooms,excellent staff and also location is wonderful in the middle of old istanbul..thanks for everything.especially thank you barisss you were very helpfully...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: davenluke
Reviews.Content: Located in a picture perfect dead end street and with no through traffic, think trailing Wisteria vines, Bougainvillea, pots full of Geraniums and Petunias and you will have an idea what it is like to walk down the street to this excellent Hotel. The rooms were great with small but very good bathrooms. The views from the Terrace are excellent, breakfast included in the price was excellent, lots of fresh good food. The staff were very friendly and helpful, we would go and stay again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: SunzOut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peninsula for 9 nites at the beginning of a month in Turkey. It was the perfect location with which to explore the city on foot. Restaurants were close, but the hotel is just off of the busy , noisy main row. The rooms were clean, bright, cheery, and in working order. The bed very comfy. All staff was pleasant, friendly, and very helpful. First name basis was established quickly. The breakast was always fresh, tastey and more than adequate. The roof top terrace was our favorite place to linger over breakfast, plan our day, and watch the hundreds of ships, ferries, and pilot boats travel though the Bosphorus. The terrace was also a special place to enjoy a bottle of wine at a peaceful spot within this bustling city. One of the best attributes of the Peninsula is the ever smiling and laughing "go-to guy" Rohat. He is a gem. He can assist with just about anything you need. From dealing with a delayed flight, shuttle arrangements, delayed luggage, phone card problems. to where to purchase train tickets. Very fun-loving and excellent english. We wanted to adopt him as our son. The Peninsuls is an exceptional value in the heart of Sultanamet.

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel Peninsula!!”
Reviews.Author: popete25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to stay in the old part of Istanbul! Rooms are clean and well maintained. The location in perfect. You can get to many major attractions on foot from the hotel. You can enjoy the start of your day with a great breakfast while enjoying the view from the roof terrace overlooking the sea; you can even see the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia from the terrace. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. We had a small problem with a light in our room and as soon as we reported it, it was taken care of. Rohat, the staff person who seemed to be around most of the time when we were there was also a great help with arranging tours and just helping with all of our questions. It was our first trip to Istanbul. Would love to go back as it is an amazing place and if/when I do, Hotel Peninsula will be my base of operations! Thanks Rohat!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: absolutsp7
Reviews.Content: I booked this place after reading about it in lonely planet and I was not disappointed. The hotel was centrally located with only a 5 minute walk to Haghia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace. The breakfast was simple, but good and the views from the terrace were outstanding. Considering what you get, the price of 60 euros a night is certainly a steal. The staff, especially Rohat, were extremely helpful and were able to answer every question I had. If I were to come back to istanbul (and this is likely), I would surely stay at the Peninsula again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, friendly staff - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: NonniAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peninsula Hotel for 6 nights at the end of May. This was the at the completion of nearly 6 weeks in Greece and Turkey and was a haven in which to relax after so much travelling. We chose this hotel from the Lonely Planet guide which gave it a thumbs up for value and friendliness. Our room was very comfortable, the bathroom large and modern and all was spotlessly clean. The staff were very friendly, helpful and enjoyed a joke with us. Breakfast on the terrace with beautiful views of the Sea of Marmaris, is a great way to start the day. The position in Sultanahmet is ideal - it's within walking distance of all the major sights and of the tram line. All in all, an absolute gem. ** While there, check out the palace that has been uncovered under a restaurant just around the corner. Go out the door of the hotel and turn right. Cross Akbiyik Cad and turn left at the next street (Kutllu Gun Sk ??) and walk along to the first restaurant - it has big glass windows at the front - walk to the side of the restaurant and go down the stairs. Lights will come on - it's amazing. They welcome visitors and it's free! They took out more than 600 truckloads of dirt one bag at a time up the stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning view atop hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattJodiIndiana
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Sultanahmet, you can't beat price and location. This is a very nice hotel in the middle of everything. Very clean and spacious rooms and friendly, helpful staff who speak English. The breakfast is the best part. High atop the roof you get a stunning view that will leave you begging for more. They even have a small laptop available for use for free. We needed to open a bottle of wine and they searched for a bottle opener for us. The staff is very attentive to guest's needs. We were very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “we highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlaWo
Reviews.Content: After two weeks of backpacking in south eastern Turkey Hotel Peninsula was the nice and luxury end of our travel:) Location is excellent, just five minutes from Aya Sofia. Room was comfortable with bathroom inside, but the best part was breakfast on the rooftop with sea view. Helpful and cheerful staff. Aleksandra & Dawid

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful terrasse better than a lot of chic terrasse in town and very welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: flamytacconi
Reviews.Content: It is a very well located hotel, clean and comfortable. We enjoyed a lot the terrasse upstair both at breakfast than in the evening sipping a beer! We felt very welcomed and received assistance and good advices!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and value”
Reviews.Author: essjayeh
Reviews.Content: From our arrival at the hotel the staff was very willing to help us with any issue and to answer any question. The room was nice and very clean. Breakfast was simple but delicious and served on an amazing deck overlooking the river and the city across the water. The location was in a bustling neighbourhood that was close to the major attractions and not too loud late at night. We would stay there again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Everything the Lonely Planet says it is...”
Reviews.Author: rads_6
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, delicious breakfast, incredible views and very friendly and helpful staff. We stayed in a basement room that was very clean and spacious with large bathroom. And right in the heart of Sultanahmet, you can't beat price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: GloJul
Reviews.Content: We only got to stay in Hotel Peninsula one night but we really liked it. The room was nice, very clean and had comfy beds. The staff are very friendly. I did notice ants coming into our room through the door from outside (not excessive) but the staff said they would take care of it after. We loved the breakfast and eating on the terrace. We actually wanted to stay again upon our return to Istanbul, but unfortunately, they were already booked out for the days we were planning to come back. We just regret that we didn't book earlier. I'd say the only problem is the location right beside the mosque so the call to prayer is blasting straight into your room, but it only lasts a couple of minutes and then I fell asleep again. Overall, excellent value for the price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem, Both in Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: MichelleDi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! We stayed 5 nights, three at the beginning and two at the end of our trip. Situated a 5-10 minute walk from the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, and the Blue Mosque, it offers charming albeit basic hotel rooms for a price that is much lower than similarly situated hotels I looked at (we paid 70 euros a night for a double). Breakfast is a satisfying buffet served on the terrace with views of the Bosphorus (there are also hammocks!). A previous reviewer wasn't kidding about the mosque behind the hotel, though --we heard that dawn call to prayer every morning, through both closed windows and earplugs. But don't let that deter you--if nothing else, the incredibly friendly and helpful staff of the hotel is well worth booking here. Rohat, ever-present at the front desk, was not only obliging in giving recommendations and setting up airport transfers, he was great fun to talk to! We learned more about Turkish culture and traditions from him than from anyone else we encountered in Turkey. We would definitely come back to this hotel if we visited Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Place”
Reviews.Author: keep_trekking
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank Rohat who works at the front desk at the hotel for making our stay in Istanbul so pleasant and memorable. He was kind and went out of his ways to help us make reservations for our flights to Kayseri and get us to the airport on time. The hotel is in an ideal location, just walking distance to most tourist attractions. Our room, although small, was clean and tastefully decorated. I highly recommend Hotel Peninsula as a place to stay and to relax after a full day of sightseeing and walking the streets of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Labroy
Reviews.Content: Not much that I can write that hasn't already been said previously. Great little hotel in an awesome location, 5 minute walk to Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque and Basicilla Cistern. The street, Akbiyik Cad, where the hotel is has a great selection of restaurants and bars that are a nice relaxed change from the hectic Divan Youli Cad. The room was quite large, although our window was next to a small mosque, so the call to prayer was loud. The breakfast was nice and fresh, the terrace view is awesome! Was really happy with our stay, the staff are really friendly and I would definately stay here again if I ever make it back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: franklyspeakingWales
Reviews.Content: Good location near cultural sites, restaurants and shops. Friendly, helpful staff and clean well furmished rooms. All we could have asked for. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: traveling_foodie1
Reviews.Content: Rohat, who manned the desk, was charming, helpful and amusing. The room are just fine, nothing fancy, but more than adequate. Clean. There is a mosque directly behind the building, so bring earplugs if you hope to sleep through the morning call to prayer. It is an easy walk to the Blue Mosque, tram lines, etc. Breakfast was good. The hotel arranges reasonably priced and efficient travel to and from the airport. My only complaint was with the hotel's arranged bath at Gedikpasa Bath, where the ride back, which was part of the price, was not available unless we were willing to wait a minimum of 30 minutes, and where it was suggested we walk back. They wouldn't even refund the cost of a tram and ended up walking back wet hair and all. Rohat said he won't sent people there anymore, but in any event, you might want to make sure you will get a ride back to your hotel if you go to this bath.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sldbe
Reviews.Content: The location, the people, the service and the good value : I will recommend this hotel to anybody. Selfishly, I would love to keep it a secret, but since they are the pick of The Lonely Planet... it speaks for itself.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: robertbionaz
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based partially on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed! The rooms were comfortable, with great bathrooms and showers. The location is superb, just steps from the Sultanahmet mosque, AyaSofya, the promenade along the Sea of Marmara, and the tram line. The hotel's ambience is quite informal, staying at the Peninsula is sort of like staying with a relative. The staff, particulary Rohat Cicek and Zeki TaÅŸdemir, were friendly-keen to interact with the guests-attentive, and highly competent. Guests at the hotel came from all over. During our week there, we met people from the U.S., Italy, Germany, Japan and Australia. Almost everyone was friendly and more than willing to share their Istanbul experiences and offer suggestions for activities and dining. Frankly, this was the best hotel experience we've ever had in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: arkzymug
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to other travellers. The hotel is within easy reach to Istanbul's main sights (Blue mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi palace) and walking distance to Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar. This location is superb! I would definitely stay here again when I am in Istanbul. Well, if I can get a room since this hotel is very popular. I stayed in the basement. The room is clean and quite (if you have quite neighboors next to your room). The only drawback if you stay in the basement is sometimes you can hear people from the level right above which is the reception floor. I don't mind as it wasn't too noisy. The hotel has all I need i.e. good location, good price, clean and quite location. The staffs are friendly and helpful ;-)

Reviews.Title: “good value for money - clean, central and fuss-free”
Reviews.Author: siewlunglui
Reviews.Content: i overnighted here on transit - the hotel i was supposed to stay at was undergoing renovation (they didn't tell me about it so i had quite a shock initially to find the place in disarray). however i was directed to a sister hotel and was put up there. the room was small but functional - hot shower, appliances in good working order, clean linens and adequate toiletries. breakfast was very good and quite abundant. staff was friendly and helpful. however, the room was kind of noisy due to the muezzin calls - but then i think this is a hazard of staying in the sultanahmet area. the central location however compensates.

Reviews.Title: “the greatest staff: helpful, kind and friendly”
Reviews.Author: daphne283
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is great, so close to a big number of historical sites. I chose it because, among other hotels in sultanahmet, it seemed to be the best deal. the rooms are nice and clean and the terrace where breakfast is served is absolutely wonderful (btw, great breakfast buffet, too). what really makes this hotel special, however, is its wonderful staff. everybody was very kind and friendly and also proved very helpful whenever we had difficulties. also, they informed us about many tourisitc services they provide, however they were not pushy and they gave us objective advice on hamams that helped us choose what we thought met our needs best. I will definetely recommend hotel peninsula to my friends visiting istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good Alternative to the more expensive places.”
Reviews.Author: Conniecz
Reviews.Content: Staying in Istanbul can be very expensive. In the old quarter near the Blue Mosque and the Palace are plenty of places but even the hostels are expensive. A friend recommended Hotel Peninsula and he met me there when i arrived. He was suppose to be staying at Hotel P but when he arrived a week earlier, they were painting and renovating so they upgraded him to the Grand Peninsula around the corner for the same price. I wasn't so lucky. :( though i tried! I arrived early in the morning and so my room wasn't ready, as expected when you arrive at 9:30 am. They sent me upstairs to the roof patio for tea and to relax while they made my room. Great views!! And a very friendly man who was doing the breakfast. He was helpful with all my questions and made me very comfortable. An hour later my room was ready and it was very comfortable, very clean and spacious but it had one problem....it stank really bad of paint!! they had just finished all the rooms at the hotel and they did a great job but i had a sensitivity with the smell. It was giving me a headache. We opened all the windows and i left for a day of sight seeing in Istanbul. When i returned, it still had a bad paint smell. I requested another room but with the whole hotel just being renovated and painted, it was no use. So i requested extra blankets and i slept with the windows wide open. :) It wasn't cold for me, being Canadian, i love it lol It felt like camping on fall evening. The noise with the windows open on a Saturday night was filled with music and street sounds but no big deal when you are as tired a was. I never had a chance to have the breakfast that was included because i had to be at the airport early but when i seen it the day before upon arrival on the roof top patio, it looked great. I would definitely recommend this hotel even though i had issue with the paint smell. I am sure it only lasted a week and all is back to normal. They did everything they could for me under the circumstances and gave a me a discount on the rate and upgraded me to a double room. i just happened to book at the wrong time but what can you do when they were improving the place? They were very accommodating and the location is in the heart of the old area with plenty of restaurants and shopping. A great alternative to the more expensive places.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Hotel in SultanAhmet”
Reviews.Author: amber712
Reviews.Content: Peninsula is a very clean, affordable, option in Sultan Ahmet. The staff is very helpful, speaks perfect English, and very used to advising tourists. The rooms are also very clean, and there is free internet/laptop in the lobby. The rate includes breakfast on the rooftop terrace, which is a great way to start the day in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on superb location and honest friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hotel_peninsula
Reviews.Content: Although the Peninsula hotel is democraticly priced, you always feel fully respected as a 'guest'. Everyone of the staff was helpfull, showed intrest en made us feel at home. To start our day there and to return to after our exhausting daily voyages of discovery, they offered us great surplus value. Thanks for your warm and honest hospitality ! Kind regards from the Family Lauwers, Belgium.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget option”
Reviews.Author: amgriffiths
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a very pleasant week in this hotel over New Year 2011. The hotel is very well located, about five minutes' walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia, both of which can be seen from the roof. Being so central is very convenient, but has its drawbacks; this area of Sultanahmet is a real tourist trap, almost exclusively given over to hotels and (in our experience) disappointing restaurants. The hotel is down a little side street, and so probably a bit quieter than many here, but we recommend asking for a room which faces away from the street; ours faced outwards, and the noise from nearby restaurants was sometimes irritating. As for the hotel itself, it's an excellent choice if you want to stay centrally on a budget. The rooms are basic but clean, the shower pressure is excellent, and there's a decent breakfast (bread, honey, hard-boiled eggs, meats, cheese) etc served on the top floor - entirely adequate if not quite the gourmet experience we'd expected from some of the other reviews on this site! The proprietor is assiduously helpful and friendly, and there's a good value (15 euro) pick up service from Ataturk airport.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Marie-germaine
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank the keeper of the Peninsula Hotel. Very friendly reception. We were a group of 9 persons. Everybody was satisfied. Thanks and perhaps, see you again! Marie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ivana93
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and tidy. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent. In any case, a wonderful place to spend a vacation :)

Reviews.Title: “A Second Home”
Reviews.Author: demelza79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a 2 week trip in Istanbul- we spent the full 2 weeks at Hotel Peninsula and feel as if we have created a second home. I will briefly cite the conveniences that seem to be reiterated in previous reviews; centrally located, great staff, clean rooms, hot water/ water pressure, and lovely views from terrace. Now, for some additional personal comments...... I cannot emphasize enough how wonderfully gracious, kind, accomodating and helpful the staff are. They were generous and personable without being overbearing or pushy. My husband is incredibly picky about where he sleeps but he absolutely loved the bed- fresh, crisp, clean linens, a firm comfy mattress, down comforter, and cozy pillows. The rooms and bathroom are extremely clean with daily cleaning service- fresh white body and hand towels every day. Also, it was extremely quite. Our room was close to the reception desk and front door but we rarely heard noise. Also, there is free wireless internet in the the room- very convenient! The breakfast consisted of a wonderful spread of assorted vegetables, fruit, jams, olives, cheeses, and bread along with fresh juice and coffee/ tea in the morning. And, I must not forget the homemade yougurt and blackberry preserves. The staff working in the dining area are equally as gracious and friendly. We spent some mornings in the kitchen just talking to the wonderful staff. Not to mention, incredible views of the sea. If you are going to be in Istanbul, you must stay at the Hotel Peninsula! Just one caution....... if you stay at the hotel, make sure you venture out into REAL Istanbul/ Turkey. The hotel is greatly located but it is situated in a very touristy area (Sultanahmet). Everyone in Sultanahment is wonderful but make sure you venture out and discover the city! Then, you can some home to your lovely hotel room! 4 stars for Hotel Peninsula!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: julie4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome. It has easily the most beautiful view you could possibly ask for on the rooftop. The Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, and the Blue Mosque are just a few blocks away. There are a bajillion restaurants at your fingertips, literally on the street in front of the hotel. FYI - the restaurants are obviously very touristy, but we found the restaurant that is literally across from the hotel's door to be the yummiest and most reasonably priced of the touristy restaurants. There are also tons of shoppes around. You can hear the ships coming in, and of course the calls to prayer. The rooms are basic but comfortable. I think some of the rooms don't have windows... so I might suggest asking for that at booking if it's important to you. The staff are very wonderful, the front desk guy that seemed to literally be there 24/7 was very, very helpful when we had random questions. The breakfast is free and on the rooftop and super yummy. One day we arrived a bit late and the gentleman made eggs just for the two of us. We used the hotel's driver for airport service and it was reasonably priced. He drove a bit nuts, but I think basically all Turkish drivers think they are Formula 1 racers. It was nice not having to worry about the taxi driver scams. The wifi was a bit spotty - but free, so no complaints here. The value for this hotel is amazing, considering the price people are paying for the same view, location, etc. The Alp Guesthouse and Sebnem (sp?) hotel are literally your neighbors. All in all, this hotel is awesome and I can't wait to return... we are seriously already planning our next trip. :)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: ilovefootscray
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our 2 week holiday in Turkey - at the start for 3 nights and for 1 night on our return before flying out. We enjoyed our stays very much. Great location on a quiet street which is very close to all of the major sights - Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque , TopKapi Palace and only 15 minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar. Our rooms (double with private bath) were comfortable and clean. There is free wifi access in room. The staff were very helpful but not pushy. I arranged transfers to/from the airport and all went well (also good value) The highlight of the hotel is the roof top terrace for breakfast. The views over Sultanahmet and the Sea of Marmara are quite spectacular. Breakfast is excellent with a good selection of Fruit., Cheese, Bread ( very good!) , Jams ( Home made) and eggs. It is a pleasant way to start the day. I recommend this hotel for its excellent value for money in a great location and for its friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and convenient place to stay in Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: walterm3
Reviews.Content: When we were booking our trip to Turkey we wanted to stay in Sultanhamet but we didn't want an expensive hotel so Hotel Peninsula was a good choice for us. The room although small was nicely decorated and comfortable. The price was very reasonable, the staff was very helpful and the breakfast on the roof terrace was very good and plentiful. There were excellent views from the terrace and it even had hammocks besides the chairs and tables. We really liked the proximity to the sights and there were restaurants and even small grocery stores all close by. The hotel itself is on a charming small dead street so it is very quiet. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay,Great Location,Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ozmen76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three friends at the beginning of a 2 week trip around Turkey. We started off our trip in Istanbul and stayed here for the first three days. Everyone was arriving to Istanbul at different times during the day, the hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful when we needed their help. They also let us use their computer in the reception area whenever we needed to.Free. Our room was facing the street but this was not a problem as the hotel was located on a quiet dead-end street. Clean rooms, great view from the terrace, good Turkish breakfast, great location for sightseeing in Sultanahmet, taxi stop nearby, very good value and friendly staff. See you next time..

Reviews.Title: “I love Turkey”
Reviews.Author: libos
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Tripadvisor and the reviews were absolutely correct. It was central, room nice and very clean.They served breakfast rooftop terrace and was great.Internet was great, the staff were great and so helpful, nothing was too much trouble, we even left out bags there a couple of days while we went to Gallipoli. Cannot fault it for a reasonably priced hotel in Istanbul, if I ever went back I would stay there again for sure.Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, lovely if quite basic rooms, and the best breakfast in Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: Trimlatte
Reviews.Content: As our first experience of Turkey we were unsure as to what we would find. This hotel is exceptional value for money, close to major attractions of the 2 mosques, Topkapi Palace, and the wonderful Basilica Cistern. Great restaurants abound in this part of Sultanahmet, and the breakfast each morning on the top of the hotel terrace was exceptional. Great views, full breakfast, and a wonderful host who we knicknames Duracell! Thanks guys for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay and relax in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: aleman1028
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and really nice. Lots of little details that made this place worth an extra 10 euro compared to some of the others around it is the area. The room had an awesome bed and a sitting area with a table to relax at after being out all day. Great breakfast on the terrace and the staff was helpful too. The bathroom was also top notch. Hot water, enclosed shower and towel heater. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Great area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LindaDownunder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Peninsula for 3 nights at the end of August, we agree with everything written about the hotel on Tripadvisor and more. This hotel is in a fantastic area of Istanbul, all the main sights are within walking distance and close to some fantastic Bars and Restaurants.The hotel is just far enough away from these that the hotel is quiet at night ( except for the call to prayer) but this did not bother us as it is all part of staying in the fantastic city of Istanbul. The roof top was a great place for breakfast which was very good, and also a great place for a pre dinner drink or nightcap what a view. The staff were very helpful at all times helping us when necessary with airport pickups, restaurants etc. Thankyou, for a great start to our 6 week holiday we would reccomend The Peninsula to anyone heading to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in central location”
Reviews.Author: kycng2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a nice stay at this hotel. It is very close to the train station and the tram station as well as major attractions in istanbul such as the blue mosque and the aya sophia. The room is nice and clean. The roof top terrace provides great view of the sea of mamara. Breakfast was delicious and the breakfast attendant provides excellent service with great selections of turkish breakfast with nice tea! I would go back to this hotel next time if I am in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with clean rooms, relaxing terrace, and excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Elisif
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend Hotel Peninsula for a stay in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. The rooms were clean, and although small, were all you needed as there was so much to see and do right outside your door. Nice small and private balcony. As far as sleep quality, the call to prayer is loud, but you will get that anywhere in the entire neighborhood (truly didn't bother us too much). There was a beautiful open terrace for the included breakfast as well as a second level with hammocks/tables, views of the Blue Mosque, and the Sea. Most importantly the customer service was excellent. You definitely have to ask for what you need, but once you do Zekt (fun and helpful!) and the other hotel manager (I regret I did not get his name) were more than accommodating in airport transfer, purchasing tickets, etc.. They even let us leave a bag for two weeks while we traveled as well as allowed us to utilize the terrace when we came back to Istanbul for the day even though we did not have a room! Above and beyond what they needed to do! We will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and freindly service with excellent views at breakfast looking over Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: jonno60
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful at the reception. In particular Zeki Tasdemir who always made time to help and was very knowledgeable about Istanbul. Zeki spoke good English and and had a good sense of humour being very freindly. I enjoyed having the traditional Turkish home made breakfast on the rooftop. The view from the roof was amazing where you see over Istanbul and the sea.

Reviews.Title: “such a lovely memory”
Reviews.Author: AmiraLondon1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was good value and great location. What a surprise when we arrived!! Beautiful street, busy but not too noisy. and our room!!! Good decoration perfect size, clean and good bathroom. My partner's step family from Albania were in the basement room, very basic and not as nice as our room but obviously for the price we could not complain. I think people giving bad reviews think this is a 5 stars hotel, well it is not and if it was the price would be far higher. Another nice surprise was the terrace!! How nice to have a breakfast when it's still fresh, sunny, and listening to the prayer. Breakfast was nice, and was a good meal to start the day. The hotel management was also very friendly and helpful. There was a nice ginger cat that was sleeping all day in the sun just outside the door :-) Overall, it's an excellent value hotel. Excellent location, not noisy, clean and tastefully decorated. Would go back. Amira

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Highly Recommended - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DANSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peninsula during June for 5 days and have tremendous praise for all aspects of the hotel. The location is central, with a short distance to Istanbul's amazing sights, as well as shops, restaurants etc. The rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable, with aircon. The breakfasts on roof-top terrace were a wonderful way to start the day - an ample spread of delciious yoghurt, fruit, olives and other typically Turkish fare - served with wonderful smiles and warmth - everyday of our stay. The staff are friendly and helpful too. Truly excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “great location, comfortable beds, spectacular views, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: hendricks11
Reviews.Content: Arrived sleep deprived after a 24 hr flight from Brisbane, it was a relief to see a sign with Hotel Peninsula & my name on it as I walked through the arrival gate. On arrival at the hotel Erhan's friendly greeting was the first of many pleasant interactions with the Peninsula staff. The 1st floor room was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated with a big window that opened on to the street. Have to say the street noise was not a problem at night with the window closed. Though the call to prayer that rings out at around 0430 was an unexpected alarm clock! ... you get used to it after a few days. The roof terrace is spectacular with views over the Marmaris, and with the Aya Sophia & Blue Mosque behind you on either side its a bit sureal. Breakfast on the terrace was a brilliant start to the day, the food was great the home made yogurt an absolute must and the warm greetings each morning from Gursel & Nevriye made you feel like part of the family. Stayed 5 fantastic days in Istanbul before venturing off to explore more of Turkey. Returned to the Peninsula 4 weeks later before flying back to Brisbane and felt like I was visiting with old friends. Special thanks to Gursel for his helpful advice and Turkish language lessons. I would and will definitely come back to the Peninsula on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass up this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: juya
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Istanbul for our honeymoon and stayed at Hotel Peninsula for two weeks. Everything about our stay was wonderful - The rooms were very clean, good showers, complimentary tea/coffee and electric kettle in the room, and A/C. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful, but not "in your face", which we appreciated. The included breakfast was varied and delicious, with wonderful local fruits and veggies, and amazing yogurt, olives, cheese, etc, etc. The breakfast attendant, Gursel, was very warm, charming, and attentive, and he really helped to make our stay special. As well, the location can't be beat - Hotel Peninsula is close to so many sights, and it was very convenient to be able to stop back quickly at our hotel room in the middle of a day of sight-seeing. Although we did not find noise to be much of a problem, earplugs are a great thing to have, especially as the hotel is right next to a small mosque and the 4am call-to-prayer can be quite loud, depending on what room you are in. But, we found that we got used to it and didn't notice it as much after a while. Thank you to all of the staff at Hotel Peninsula for a wonderful and memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jess79uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good budget hotel, located in the Sultanahmet area with easy access to some of Istanbul's greatest tourist attractions. The rooms were clean and spacious. I asked for an extra sheet and blanket and they provided this. I was also pleased to find a hairdryer in the bathroom. My only criticism is that the mattress could have been more comfortable. There was plenty of food to choose from at breakfast time and on the warmer mornings you could enjoy the views of the Bosphorus on the roof terrace. The reception desk is always manned and they are very helpful. They will book your airport transfer for you for a very good rate (10 Turkish Liras/Â£5).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: WonderWilma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Peninsula for three nights before our tour started. The staff are very nice, the rooms/bed are comfortable and clean. The breakfast is nice - in particular the home made yogurt. The roof top area is a beautiful spot to eat breakfast overlooking the Blue Mosque, Sophia and the water. Reasonable priced airport transfer were arranged for us and there was always a quick and informative response to any emails I sent to them when making the booking. It is in a great location. The only downside is that it is so close to the Mosques that the call to Prayer wakes you up very early in the morning. Definately recommend you stay here as great value.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time, likely the last”
Reviews.Author: ZacharyS
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for exploring Sultunamet and we have stayed here three times as we have brought people to Istanbul who were particularly interested in the area. The first time we came the staff was super friendly. The second time, not as much, but I shrugged it off. This third time the front end staff was particularly unfriendly and indifferent to my questions. This time we stayed for a whole week so we needed to get to some far out places and I would ask the front end guy that is usually there for help and he would give me a very short answer that I would later find out needed much more explanation, but I would not realize this until the most inopportune time. We had three rooms in the Grand Peninsula, and an un air conditioned room in the Grand Peninsula down the street. It was particularly warm when we were there and I encouraged the person in the Grand Peninsula to ask for a different room as they were having trouble sleeping, they didnâ€™t want to do that, so I guess that is their problem. In the Peninsula my mother in law had a single room where the AC broke in the middle of the night with three nights to go. She asked in the morning if they could take a look at it and they did and said they would call a service person out and get it fixed that day. We got back that night and were told â€œitâ€™s Sunday, no one can come out on a Sundayâ€�, she was a bit sick and suffered through the night (we found out the next day). We asked about it again and were told â€œit will be fixed tonightâ€�. We returned that night, nothing was fixed, no explanation. I asked at the front desk and was told â€œitâ€™s brokeâ€� which I obviously knew. I asked more questions, and finally he reluctantly turned off the TV he was staring at. He said the repair man came but they would have to replace the whole unit, and went to doing something else. I interrupted and asked, is there another room, he replied â€œIf I would have known about this earlier I could have found another room, but there are none nowâ€�â€¦ what? How was I to know that the AC would not be fixed? I would think a properly run hotel would take care of the situation on their own. My elderly mother in law was in a hot humid room for two nights (I wasnâ€™t going to have her sleep in it a third night), I felt they should have moved her to a different room. I asked what else they could do and got a shrug. My wife finally convinced them to find a spare bed and move her to our room, which they did, without a refund for the night. Also one night in the stay we came back to our room late and nothing had been cleaned other then the comforter pulled to the top of the bed, including no new towels, which wouldnâ€™t normally be a problem other then it was humid and they were still wet and the shower flooded and the bath mat was completely drenched. We mentioned it to the others and my mother in law noted that her garbage was overflowing but not taken out, and the other couple had their old towels and bath mats removed and replaced with a singular clean towel. This obviously is not as big of deal, but thought I would note it. If I were to stay in Sultunamet again I would definitely look for a different hotel. The one bright spot, as always was the breakfast man, Girzelle. One of my favorite people in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Great breakfast, Great location”
Reviews.Author: aterrycalif
Reviews.Content: I was well taken care of by Erhan and the rest of the staff. It was always a pleasure to talk with them and Erhan went out of his way to be helpful to me. I would definitely come back to this hotel. My room was o.k. but nothing exceptional and was priced very reasonably. There are four floors of rooms with a lot of steps to get to the roof for the view and the breakfast - but worth the climb.

Reviews.Title: “One of Istanbul's hidden gems”
Reviews.Author: coraliewilliam
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was a major highlight of our 5 week journey through Turkey. While this hotel lacks a grand entrance, everything about it is grand. The management were enormously accommodating, the food was varied and nutritious, the views from its two roof decks were superb, and the breakfast room and the breakfast host were delightful. Our comings and goings allowed us to sample a variety of rooms which all contained their own unique features My inclination is not to heed the "falsely charming", and therefore I warmed easily to the staff here, who genuinely treated us with quiet, natural and welcoming respect. For us, travelling is nearly all about people, and we thought that the staff at this hotel depicted our other experiences of Turkish people: warm, gentle, friendly and accommodating. There were no let downs ..... A return to Turkey in the future to this hotel...... would be a delight. Selamun aleykum William and Coralie, Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality and great location!”
Reviews.Author: JacqiandAllen
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Hotel Peninsula was excellent. I'll start with the room and end with the people: The room was clean and comfortable. The location was perfect... we could walk to everything (and there's plenty to see within a very short 5 minute walk) and/or jump on the public transit if needed. Each morning we started our day with breakfast (upstairs) on the terrace with other travelers. The breakfast was wonderful but the warmth and hospitality from Gursol (the owner )made our trip. We shared our day's adventures with him (and others) and he hugged us (literary) and we could not ask for a better host. Gursol and his cats (Bonjouk) will always be a cherished part of our Turkish adventure. Stay here... you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Rude and disinterested”
Reviews.Author: tallandsomeone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the volcano cloud and got no sympathy from the rude reception staff. One member of staff in particular was dismissive and monosyllabic, ie "no" or "don't know". Strangely, the price had gone up over and above the price stated in the hotel's own website. Then the guy wanted access to the room for annual aircon service, when I was asleep after a long flight. Then he wanted us to change rooms after we'd already had breakfast and been out shopping. We said no. Enquiries for directions and laundry were met with negative grunts. Eventually, my friend got the last seat on a Pegasus flight, but I was still stuck. I could only book one night at a time, so they kicked me out. I could understand that they had other bookings, but they were just rude about it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably price boutique hotel/ Grand Hotel Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: lalikes
Reviews.Content: Don't be confused with the United States version of the Peninsula Hotel. Not the same. However, for $100 a night you have a quaint, clean and well furnished room. There is a terrace where breakfast is included and a view as well. The staff is courteous, helpful and accommodating. It is located in the touristy area but we never felt like it was that way. When there, they were constructing an additional location. Address: Adliye Sokak No.6 (off Akbiyik Cad) 34400 Sultanhamet Istanbul, Turkey

Reviews.Title: “An absolute bargain!”
Reviews.Author: snowpeajane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an absolute bargain. The reception staff were extremely helpful, the bed comfortable and the shower awesome. A much nicer hotel than some hotels I have paid 2-3x (and more!) for! To top it off, breakfast is included and there is much to choose from. The setting for breakfast was amazing on the rooftop, looking out over the sea. The hotel is also located in a street with an abundance of restaurants/cafes to choose from, which are all open late- great for a late flight! Looking forward to staying here again later in the month. Would recommend to all without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “quaint good value friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: thefactsLondon
Reviews.Content: Just right for travellers on a budget who do not want to sacrifice sleep/service/cleanliness. We transfered here for our last night from a noisy hotel, and I am very glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service are second to none”
Reviews.Author: BubG
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The service was excellent and started with a seamless airport transfer to the hotel. When we arrived we simply couldn't believe the location. We went straight up to the roof and had an impressive view of the water and realised just how close we were to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The reception staff came to know us and they were always welcoming and friendly. We were given a free tourist map, suggestions on where to go and when and we had access to free wireless internet. After a long day of sightseeing the hot powerful shower was a dream! The highlight of our stay was probably the freshly prepared breakfast served in the dining room on the roof level. There was fresh bread, cakes, yoghurt and fruit - all home made and absolutely delicious! Also, make sure you visit the little restaurant on the corner directly opposite the hotel. There are endless dining options within a short walk, but this was by far our favourite!

Reviews.Title: “The most courteous staff in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: BackpackingBetty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the heart of Sultanhamet. The charm of its surroundings is only part of its appeal. The building is well maintained and the rooms were exceptionally clean and had character. The staff in this hotel as well as its sister hotel the Grand Peninsula were remarkable, going beyond what would be expected to make us comfortable and help us enjoy our stay in Istanbul, a perfect example of Turkish hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brownie2012
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 8 nights at the Hotel Peninsula with my boyfriend and another couple. We had a great time in Istanbul, and Hotel Peninsula was the perfect place to stay on our student's budget. The central location in Sultanahmet is ideal if you want to do sightseeing, and always easy to get back to at night. The rooms were basic but suited our needs just fine, especially considering the relatively low price. Breakfast was great, a perfect way to start each morning. It was too cold to sit outside, but we did go up and admire the view, I imagine it would be lovely in the summer. We also appreciated that the staff were always friendly and willing to offer any help, from arranging pick up and drop off at the airport, to making reservations, to just welcoming us back warmly each night. One thing to be aware of: They allow but don't like you using credit cards to pay. My friends tried to pay with their cards and had trouble getting them to split the bill between their cards (though they did do it) and charging the ride from the airport (we had to let them borrow some of our liras). My boyfriend and I paid cash and had no trouble. Overall, I would be happy to return here if I ever make my way back to Istanbul, a very nice hotel in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, comfortable and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: carolineToronto
Reviews.Content: I believe that this is a wonderful hotel for both a short or an extended stay in Istanbul. The location cannot be beat if you are intent upon ferreting out all the must-see sights. You are within a quick walk of Topkapi, Ayasofya, the Cistern, the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Art, the Mosaic Museum, the Palace of Bucoleon, the Sublime Porte, et al. All the staff at the Peninsula were wonderful during our two week stay. Without exception, they went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, and were very helpful in solving any problems that came up while visiting this extraordinary city I would suggest earplugs if you are a light sleeper, as no matter where you stay you will hear the call to prayer five times a day---but this is anywhere in the City, double glazing aside. The hotel itself was perfectly quiet, and we did not hear our neighbours. The only suggestion I would have for this engaging establishment is to somehow find a way to have a well-lit public room, so those of us who cannot sleep in the wee hours (and are too boorish to pray) can sit comfortably somewhere and immerse ourselves in in a book by Yasar Kemal , Pamuk, Rahmi or Emre. We had a perfect holiday, other than it being a week too short!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: FightingForMyRights
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel very much. I booked our room by email and they were very prompt with their responses to my emailed requests. When we arrived we were asked wether we had wanted a twin room or a double room. We preferred a twin room but they didn't have any that night, and apparently i had not specified it in my email to them. They moved us to a larger twin room the next day, and did not charge us extra for the larger room. The staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The small rooms are very small, but they are clean and comfortable. Breakfast was at the sister hotel across the road. It was a basic breakfast but still delicious. We opted for the airport transfers to and from the hotel, and the driver was also very friendly and informative, despite speaking very little English. The hotel is also very conveniently located near the main sights in Sultanhamet. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND VALUE”
Reviews.Author: kitdf
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location in Sultanahmet could hardly be better. The staff is friendly. It offers a very good value, though some small aspects of the facilities could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “No place like home”
Reviews.Author: michaellyonsca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were staying in Istanbul as a layover before returning home after a long trip in Egypt. We were offered a airport pickup for 15 Eruo--which I'm glad we took as it is quite far from the hotel. When we arrived, the guy at the front desk immediately checked us in, and gave us a map of Sultanemeht (spell check?). The next morning we were stunned by the breakfast that they offer. It might seem like a typical breakfast, but everything is homemade, and amazing! Plus the guy who was serving the breakfast was extremely accommodating, and bent over backwards to make sure we were fed well (he cooked it all by himself!). Needless to say, within one day we felt like we were at home. We had everything we needed and more. I think the one person who stood out the most was a guy named, Nedjet. He always had a smile on his face, was completely laid back, and willing to do anything to make us feel safe in secure. When we left to catch our flight home, my wife forgot her passport at the hotel. I panicked and called the hotel right after being dropped of by the pickup/drop off service. I reached Nedjet who said in a very calm voice, "don't worry, stay right where you are, and the driver will be right back to drop off another guest. He will bring the passport with him in less than an hour.". When I offered him any amount of money out of extreme gratitude he said it was his pleasure and that it wasn't necessary! Sure enough, the driver returned in about 40 minutes with my wife's passport in tow, and we made our flight!! I have read some reviews here, and I respect the various opinions. However, I think that people are people, and as such they are entitled to have "off-days". If you stick around for a little while, you might just be surprised and experience what we experienced. Oh yeah, and don't forget to try the Yogurt...it's homemade and the best thing I've ever taste. Be sure to pet the resident cat, Bonjyek as well!!! Thanks, Nedjet!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Grand...”
Reviews.Author: NathAng
Reviews.Content: I also was a victim of the Lonely planet review, but i guess that's not the hotel owners fault. We arrived very late, but the chap on the desk was quite pleasant for 1am. The room was basic, but the bed was comfortable. We did get the yoghurt and home made jams which were the highlight of the breakfast. If you are after somewhere comfortable to base yourself then this is a pretty good bet. I ended up being a bigger fan of Beyaglou (better restaurants, bars, cafe's) than Sultahnamet, so that perhaps is the bigger question of where to stay.... It's location to the main tourist sightseeing haunts can't be questioned however.

Reviews.Title: “very nice staying...”
Reviews.Author: mausi77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Peninsula for four nights and were very happy with our experience. It was second time for us in Peninsula and it was realy nice too.It is located in a good area with lots of food options nearby, and even a view of the Blue Mosque and Sea of Marmara from the rooftop. Staff was always friendly, rooms were clean and it was quite affordable. What more can you want?

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve Lonely Planet's Top Pick for Budget hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: birdonbike
Reviews.Content: When our arrangements to stay with a friend fell through, My Fiancee and I opened our Lonely Planet book and spotted the description of the Hotel Peninsula read as follows: "The management of this unassuming hotel could quite possibly be the friendliest we've ever encountered. And we're talking friendly in a good, non-pushy, we-really-like-meeting-people type of way, not the hi-I'm-your-new-best-friend-please-visit-my-carpet-shop type of way. There are 12 simple but comfortable rooms that are slated for renovation in the near future, as well as a lovely terrace with sea views and comfortable hammocks. We like the breakfast room with its traditional low stools and brass tables and we love the fact that the owner's mum makes cakes, jam and yogurt for everyone's breakfast. Great value. " We were beyond shocked to be received as coldly as we were by the management especially after reading a review like that. The manager could hardly peel his eyes away from the video game he was playing on his computer to answer our request for some hot water for tea, which was an immediate no. We did happen to arrive during the time of renovations which continued well into the late evening hours. Our room was decent enough with very comfortable beds, however there was hardly any room to move if you had any luggage what so ever. Breakfast was a let down considering the praise from Lonely Planet and the jam, yogurt, and non-existent cakes from the partner hotel across the street (with equally cold management) was with out a doubt not from someone's "mum", not to mention it came with day old bread if you did not arrive early. For 75 lira for a double, we would think you could find a much nicer "budget" hotel in the area. In fact, we think Lonely Planet must have confused this hotel with a different one because they simply did not match up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Kalasands
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennisular is a pleasant and well kept hotel. Very clean, and very nice rooms. The shower is great - large and pressure is brilliant! Nice staff and breakfast not only the normal bread and jams but also including yoghurt. and fruit. Breakfast is served with a view of the ocean on one side and Higia Sophia on other side from the roof deck. The hotel organises a transfer to and from airport. Recommend to choose the shuttle option rather than the pickup service which is more expensive. The hotel is in an excellent location - close to both the Higia Sophia and Blue Mosque as well as lovely restaurants. Recommend to walk by the Blue Mosque in the evening - unbelievable stunning when lit up. Jean and Sandy
