Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: hbhb44
Reviews.Content: We cannot recommend this hotel too highly. It is in a superb location, five minutes walk from main sights and with plenty of good places to eat from budget to indulgent within a couple of minutes walk, in an atmospheric part of town. We were greeted with a drink, made to feel hugely welcome, and the room was lovely - spacious, spotlessly clean and very quiet. We had lots of help with how to get the best out of our stay, the staff were interested and courteous, from the front desk through to cleaning and dining staff, but never intrusive. The view from the roof terrace is stunning, to sit up there as the light fades overlooking the bospherous and the blue mosque whilst evening prayers are called was magical. We would like to thank all the staff again for such a wonderful stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “At the time beeing breakfast at neighboring hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcnord
Reviews.Content: As quite a few people has mentined the nice breakfast in great rooftop breakfast room/terracce -including the feline friends there, I thought I should mention that during our stay (last week) breakfast was served at "sister hotel" across the street. Appearently because of renovations of Peninsiulas breakfast room. The breakfast was rather boing - mostly those prepacked little portions of jam, nutella. One morning when we arrived for breakfast shortly before 8:30, they were not even open yet. In general we were happy at Peninsula, great location, heathing and plenty of warm water. As it is winter, the "wake up call" from the nearby minaret was not until 6:45. We would stay there aain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, simple hotel/no television/good location/friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cch1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on a Lonely Planet recommendation. The hotel is located just below the Hagia Sofia and is walking distance to both the Hagia and Blue Mosque. Both are visible from the hotel's rooftop as is the Sea of Marmaris and lighthouse. There is a tram stop behind the Hagia Sofia for access to other parts of the Eastern shore of Istanbul. We stayed on rooms on the first floor on two separate times during our trip. In the first room, the wooden floor was breaking to the point where it was ready to lose a slat and the toilet flushing mechanism didn't work well. The second room faced the street. You will hear the 6 AM call to prayer from the nearby mosques from everywhere in the hotel. There is no television, so plan on reading or walking the touristy street the hotel is on in the evenings. We spent our nights on the rooftop watching the heavy shipping moving into and out of the Sea of Marmaris despite it being quite cool. Climate control in the rooms is good. Water pressure and hot water in the showers was good, as well. Hotel staff are friendly and accommodating. The Istanbul fish market (which I found very tidy and interesting) is two train stops from the hotel along the shore beneath the hill the hotel rests on. I would recommend this hotel as a fairly simple accommodation and central point to stay at in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, friendly, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shanemaher
Reviews.Content: Istanbul seems to be a reasonably expensive place to stay so the Hotel Peninsula at about â‚¬25-30 a night was decent value. Compared to other parts of Turkey however it would be overpriced. The breakfast was very nice and roof terrace did have a lovely view of the sea. Overall a relaxed atmosphere. Staff very helpful and knowledgable for booking onward transportation etc. Didnt try pushing any tours/nights out which was nice. However a bit more information about the hotel services and local amenities would have been useful. The rooms were of a decent standard - clean but nothing to get excited about so fine if you are mainly out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and cute cats”
Reviews.Author: keito80
Reviews.Content: We spent our last two nights in Istanbul at this hotel, and found it was great value for money. The breakfast on the roof-top terrace was great, and the two cute hotel cats proved very entertaining. The free internet access in reception was really useful. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A complete pleasure”
Reviews.Author: neilbwh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Peninsula for 12 nights in Oct/Nov 2009. It was terrific and I would stay there again. The staff are helpful and are a big plus for the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and cleaned daily. Room decore was average -- it's not a priority for me in budget accommodation. The shower is outstanding: plentiful hot water, strong water pressure and sensible controls. The breakfast is among the best I've experienced in European budget hotels -- the only meat was a nondescript sausage but there were cheeses (nice feta), olives, seasonal fruits & vegetables (pears and grapes some days) creamy yoghurt, hard boiled eggs, nice bread and coffe/tea/juice. It was take-what-you-like rather than a set portion.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: hannypops
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated a stroll away from the Blue Mosque and offers tasty breakfasts, warm and friendly service and incredible views. The room was a little basic but great value. I would thoroughly recommend a visit to the roof terrace, not just for the views but to play with the cats who reside here too! A welcoming and great value find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service with wonderful location!!”
Reviews.Author: mc_cornish
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Istanbul many times with my family and have found Peninsula to be the place we will always stay. The location is perfect and the hotel is a beautiful little gem. I especially love the rooftop, in the summer I can lay on hammocks and read with Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque in my peripheal vision. the breakfast is fantastic, with homemade yogurt and fruit preserves and real brewed coffee. On one occasion I was unable to get a family room at Peninsula for last 2 nights so they booked me at their new hotel grand peninsula which was just as superb. I especially loved the clean bedding and the pretty well decorated rooms. The manager, Huseyin, is always very helpful and accomodating to me. He always makes sure my trips to Istanbul are comfortable and safe. I have stayed at many hotels throughout the world and find Peninsula to be my favorite, in it's elegant simplicity.I passed through south of turkey to antalya and isparta for the rest of our trip.if someone interest to see a small town with lovely location,pure green lake and friendly people,they should go to Egridir which locates north of isparta. I am so looking forward to visiting Turkey again and beginning my trip with a few days Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: jandp09
Reviews.Content: Personally I would stay here for the views from the roof terrace alone - sitting with a fantastic breakfast (or watching the sun go down in the evening) with the aya sofia, the blue mosque and the water around you was spectacular. It's fantastically located for sight-seeing and the metro, and was very easy to reach from the airport on local transport. The room was clean and good sized with a very nice bathroom. My only issue would be that it was pretty loud outside (to be expected in Istanbul I guess, and probably worsened that in the basement room we were very close to ground level) and the air-con didn't work in our room as the remote was out of batteries (again, not a big issue and could have been fixed by us asking for it). Helpful staff who were happy to let you use the computer there for online check in meant we had a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: NYCLoftdweller
Reviews.Content: Good value, great location, fine service. When I complained about a boat trip purchased at the hotel, they immediately refunded ALL my money - even though I was willing to pay at least half the cost. I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: M00sin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and the staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. They had so many tips about where to eat, places to see in Istanbul, they booked shuttles for us etc.. etc... Really great. The rooms were basic but nice enough and the terrace on the roof where breakfast is served (again the breakfast guy was amazingly friendly) is lovely. Great location - very close to (i.e. walking distance) Aya Sophia, the Blue Mosque, shopping, the tram, a street with loads of restaurants, basically everything you need. Free internet. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel + Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: amitmk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Sep 2009. Had a triple room. It was much smaller than i expected and hence the room got cramped once the bags were taken inside. The bathroom is reasonably fine in size and kept very clean. We enjoyed our stay here because of the location. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Sultanahment tram station are all within walking distance. The lane just outside the hotel is filled with other hotels and restaurants and has a super atmosphere evening onwards with people just chilling out on the rugs and pillows kept outside the restaurants. This place remains lively till atleast about 0100 am and it was great just walking around the place at night. Even the lil grocery stores are open till about midnight. The hotel staff is extremely courteous and helpful. They made arrangements for airport pick up and drop for 15 euros each way. Never mind the no. of people. The breakfast consisted of cheese, salads, boiled eggs, cake, tea, coffee & juice. Very very basic but good enough for the price. It is served on the terrace from where you get an awesome view of the Bosphorus. I stayed at the Grand Peninsula too before catching my flight out of Turkey on my way back. Didn't find anything grand about it. Preferred Peninsula more than the Grand Peninsula. I will certainly stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I'm so happy I stayed at Hotel Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: Bikocat
Reviews.Content: As a late-middle-aged solo woman traveller on my first trip to Istanbul I was fortunate to have chosen this reasonably-priced superbly situated hotel where the service could not have been friendlier. My room had private bath, AC, telephone- no TV, but I would not have watched it anyway- Istanbul is fascinating and after an 8-day stay I had barely scratched the surface. The roof-top terrace where breakfast is served has a fantastic view across the Sea of Marmara with Asia on the other side- my room had usually been cleaned by the time I'd finished my coffee and fruit, among other choices- great yoghurt! The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Agia Sofia, ATMs, etc. etc. are a 5-10 minute walk away: the whole area is clean, safe, and friendly. One caveat: there is a mosque next door with amplified calls to prayer, starting at daybreak, which might bother some people- in my case I quickly got used to it, looked forward to it, and miss it now I'm away. I could not have made a better choice and look forward to returning as soon as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: noone28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location close to all the sights. The room was really nice and had air-conditioning. It was very pleasant having breakfast on the roof terrace. The staff were really friendly. The hotel also organised an airport pick-up for us which made getting to the hotel hassle-free.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Spuddie11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Peninsula Hotel for several nights on two separate occasions on our recent trip to Istanbul. We couldn't have asked for more - great value for money, it's in a great location - walking distance to all the sites in the old city as well as the tram to travel to Beyoglu and Taksim. The staff are very welcoming and more than accommodating with advice and help. The standard rooms are small but they are perfectly fine and are absolutely clean and well maintained. Breakfast on the terrace is a bonus as is the free wireless internet. Thanks to everyone for the fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: AndyouandI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Peninsula 3 nights in the beginning of July, and 2 nights at the end of July. The young men who work reception are friendly and speak perfect English and were helpful with arrangin airport transport both times and with giving us directions to the sights. The breakfast that was included in the price of the room is served on the roof terrace and is incredible! (Say hello to Gursel for us. He works during breakfast and was by far the friendliest person we met in all of Turkey, and we met a lot of friendly people!) The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern. The park is about a 20 minute walk away, and Topkapi Palace is about 10 minutes further. The rooms are extremely comfortable with enough space for our bags to be down and us still able to walk around easily. Cons? The first room we were in was on the first floor and so we could hear a lot of the people who would come in late talking. Our second room was on the second floor and did have a weird smell that another reviewer mentioned, almost like a backed up toilet. The smell was only in the bathroom, and we found we could eliminate it by keeping the bathroom door closed. But that was it. The pros of staying here far outweigh the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly clean boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlypurple
Reviews.Content: We booked in advance getting confirmation by email. They arranged a transfer from the airport (15 Euros) which was friendly and efficient. Email communication was prompt and helpful. The rooms were clean and tidy. The airconditioning kept the room cool in very hot weather but It took a little while to work out how to use it as there were no instructions. Breakfast was served on the upstairs terrace, (the food was always fresh and plentiful and the staff friendly). From the upper terrace there are panoramic views of the Bosphorus and AyaSophia (but a future roof extension to another Hotel could potentially reduce the view of the Mosque). The staff were friendly and helpful, we were able to use a laptop for free to check emails etc. The rooms were serviced every day. This is a basic, clean, friendly boutique hotel. One problem for light sleepers is the call to prayer at 5am from the nearby minaret (about 20 metres away - with loud speakers), although this can be reduced in volume by closing the door at the end of the corridor (open for ventilation) before going to bed. (Having said that our son and his girlfriend stayed with us and slept through the call.) And any way there's no escaping the call to prayer as several Mosques are always audible from any location you might choose. My only other complaint is the tarriff being quoted in Euros and them using a daily conversion to Liras. We asked before arriving what currency to use and they said they didn't mind, I didn't think to ask for the tariff in Liras. Why would the Lira tarriff change according to the Euro exchange rate in a country that still uses the Lira on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and friendly attitude, a gret place to stay”
Reviews.Author: photojeni
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of this place on trip advisor, and in our guide, I decided to pay a little more and book the larger double at this Hotel. I was not disappointed. All the staff were polite and friendly and really helpful. We also had access to the Internet whenever we wanted which was really helpful. The hotel itself is off a main street filled with many hostels, hotels,bars and restaurants, but we had a room facing the back. I was pleased as I wonder how noisy it might be at the front. However, my previous experience of staying a hostel along the main street tells me that the noise does not go on really late into the night. The room was larger than average, hence the extra price, and clean, with air conditioning. The trrace was wonderful, with views over to the Sea of Mamara, and was an excellent venue for breakfast, which was very good. Always plenty of variety, including boiled eggs, cheese, meat, salad, olives, jams (some of which were home made), honey, yoghurt, cake (again home made I think), and bread, with tea, coffee and juice also available. Again the staff were really freiendly and helpful. The terrace, as well as having charis and tables also has some hammocks, which is a nice touch, and we were free to take drinks and food up there whenever we wanted. All in all I think that the room was well worth the price if you want to stay in Sutlanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, lovely staff, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraOswego_NY
Reviews.Content: Hotel Peninsula is located a few blocks away from the major touristy sights of the Sultanahmet. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated, clean bathrooms, with some of the 'firmest' beds I've ever slept on. The staff was very eager to share their recommendations and converse with us in general. They helped us figure out how to get where we wanted to go. They helped us to practice Turkish over the delicious breakfast on the rooftop deck every morning. There were 16 people traveling in our group, and every single one of us had only good things to say. I'll be there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: MrsVAuckland
Reviews.Content: As grandparents we travelled with children and 4 little girls - we were thoroughly looked after by the staff at the Peninsula, nothing was too much trouble from arranging taxies, storing luggage to arranging tour guides. Breakfast on the roof was wonderful and again the kitchen staff were great. They rooms were very clean and the showers awesome.. There is free wireless connections in all rooms. We have nothing but good to say about our stay in an awesome city, we could walk everywhere from the hotel and felt very safe doing so.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dilos
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul last week and stayed at the peninsula hotel and it was realy nice stay.hotel is in center of sultanahmet and it is very clean. They served breakfast on the their terrace and it was realy nice.

Reviews.Title: “What they say is true”
Reviews.Author: MarkTP
Reviews.Content: The great young staff are eager to please and importantly we found them rereshingly genuine. We found the rooftop terrace the ideal spot starting and ending the day and generally taking it all in. Istanbul never sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: GoodAdviceHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Peninsula for two nights and were very happy with our experience. It is located in a good area with lots of food options nearby, and even a view of the Blue Mosque and Sea of Marmara from the rooftop. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean and it was quite affordable. What more can you want?

Reviews.Title: “Always excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: berurier
Reviews.Content: It's the second time I sleep in this hotel. Always excellent place, staff has changed a bit but the new guys are also very polite and friendly. The single room for 40 euros a night is a perfect value for money. Just expect a decent and nice clean place where to sleep, that is what you will get here. PS : the nice red cat is not here any more, they lost it. But it looks like a new one installed himself at the hotel. I met him several times and he was very kind !

Reviews.Title: “Quality budget hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: circuswestie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Peninsula for 3 nights. The room was basic, but very clean, with an excellent shower, and air conditioning. The hotel serves a delicious Turkish breakfast on the roof terrace, which has views of the Bosphorous. I loved the fresh yoghurt and fruit jams. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The only real downside of the hotel for us was noise. We had a room facing the street, and there was music and noise from the nearby cafes until about 2am. Of course this wasn't the hotel's fault, but it did impact adversely on our stay as we were trying to get an early start to see the sites before the heat and the crowds. Because of the noise we had to resort to sleeping with the windows closed and the air conditioning on, which also kept us awake as it blasted cold air directly on to the bed. Also, while the bed was comfortable, I would have preferred the option of a sheet, in addition to the Turkish-style bedcover which was supplied. The location of the hotel is within walking distance to the major sites of Sultanahment - Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica cistern, Grand Bazaar etc. The downside of this is that it is a very touristy area, and we got a bit fed up with being hassled by carpet and restaurant touts every time we left the hotel. We also found we had to go to other parts of town to find places to eat that had authentic Turkish food and didn't overinflate their prices for tourists. I felt Hotel Peninsula offered reasonable value for money, although elsewhere in Turkey we enjoyed a similar standard of accomodation for about half the price. For some reason a lot of the hotels in Turkey, and particularly Istanbul, price in Euros, rather than Turkish lira, which pushes up the price for those of us with weaker currencies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - great staff - gentle for your pocket”
Reviews.Author: Qbasa
Reviews.Content: I have spent (together with my spouse) 5 days/nights in Hotel Peninsula. It was very cosy, the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfest is tasteful and served on nice terrace with overview of Bosphorus - to see the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, you have to move one level up. The room was tidy and cosy; it had double bed, ac, nice bathroom with shower and hair dryer. It's all a traveller can desire to have while visitting such a beautiful town. The distance to main touristic attractions (e.g. Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque) is ridiculous - it's a 3 (three) minute walking from the hotel. You cannot imagine a better location. We had a muezin singing just 50 meters from our window, but I guess this just the way it is in muslim countries, although you have to get used to prayer at 4:30 AM :-) Just to sum up: Peninsula Hotel provide us with more then we could think of. I would definitely visit it once again - Jakub A. Sadulski

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, warm and friendly staff - would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: SianGLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peninsula for 2 nights last week and really enjoyed it. The staff are very friendly, the breakfast is a traditional Turkish buffet with a beautiful view of the sea from the rooftop terrace (with hungry cat!), and the rooms are clean and tidy. We stayed in a ground floor room and even though we're two young women travelling, we didn't feel unsafe in any way. The guys at the front desk gave us advice on a few different things, and were always welcoming. We were also able to use their shuttle service to Sabiha Gokcen airport for only 12 Euro each. All in all I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. The only reason why we haven't given it a five is because you may still be able to get similar places for a slightly better price, and the rooms are fairly basic (no tv, etc) , but for the price it was more than adequate and the room was by no means a tight squeeze. We are telling family who are visiting Istanbul later this year to stay in this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality exemplified”
Reviews.Author: simonkmoore
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious, very clean, with separate bathroom, A/C and clean crisp linen. Lovely rooftop complete with hammocks and a view over the Sea of Marmara, the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. Whilst there is no bar at the hotel, there is no problem with buying your own drinks and food and taking them up there - the hotel staff were more than happy for us to invite some new-found friends up to share a drink with us. The staff were nothing short of brilliant - friendly and always helpful....they even taught us the intricacies of how to play backgammon. The location is only a short walking distance to the major old-city landmarks (Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Spice Bazaar, Grand Bazaar, Bosphorous cruises. Hotel Peninsula feels hospitable, safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Simple wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Souschef88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Peninsula in Istanbul in May for about 6 days in total. We had the large double room. The room was very cozy and spacious. It is extremely clean. The shower was awesome. The breakfast was wonderful. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We love the view from the rooftop. The location is so central that is walking distance from everything. We loved Istanbul. We would definitely go back to Hotel Peninsula when we go back to Istanbul. Thank you Hotel Peninsula. the Canadian couple

Reviews.Title: “REASONABLE, BASIC 2 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: skhMontreal_Quebec
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Istanbul (mid-May 2009) and had an overnight stay at the Peninsula. I took advantage of their airport pickup for 15 Euro (most hotels charge 25 Euro or it's free if you stay for atleast 3 nights), and their driver was right there to pick me up even though they had garbelled my name on the sign card. The location of the hotel is excellent, just a 5 minute walk down & then up hill to Hagia Sofia, but then again, this neighbourhood is hotel central. They didn't have any single room available (40 Euro) for the date I required, but gave me a double room (i.e. 2 single beds) at the off-season rate of 50 Euro which fit my budget. The room is very clean, comfortable, 2nd hand type of furniture in good condition, decent size for 2 people, though not that big. No special amenities, no tv or phone in the room that I can recall. The bathroom was very clean, a bit worn and the shower stall was very small, but functioned fine. The hotel is really a 5-10 minute walk to all the main attractions, including the lively and cute Akbiyak Cad with its various restaurants. I wasn't too impressed with the hotel terrace (old resin chairs & tables, smaller terrace right at the top with hamacs), the hotel next door has one that is much better and nicer. You can go their for tea (cay) or dinner as they have a roof top restaurant. The breakfast didn't impress me that much as most of it was gone by 8:00 am and they didn't refill, but from what was left, it did seem to be fresh, especially the bread. The staff was very congenial. The one thing I wished they had available was maps of the city. It would be so useful when you've just arrived and trying to place things in a new city. The pamphlets/maps the Tourist Info center uses would be a good idea. You do hear the first call for prayer in the early morning very clearly, but that didn't bother me, and overall the street was pretty quiet. All in all, for my duration of stay it was fine but I realized that there are many hotels in Sultahnamet within this price range, and more towards the 3 star range.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: Photos_On_The_Road
Reviews.Content: We liked this small hotel, located close to all the major tourist attractions of Sultanahmet, with a beautiful terrace with a view over the Bosphorus and Marmara Sea, Hagya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. You can have breakfast on the terrace and even relax on hammocks. Rooms are a bit small but clean and comfortable. Yje hotel is at one edge of a quiet street dotted with restaurants and cafes. The only and unique problem is the voice of the muezzin that will wake you up every day around 4 a.m..

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: marlouv
Reviews.Content: Fantastic price, location, and breakfast. Rooms are comfortable. Very friendly and helpful staff. Walking distance to all major Sultanahmet attractions. A great stay. Tried to return again but they were full. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay at the Hotel Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: jlh282
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and accommodating. Even got us an extra room on short notice for a really busy weekend. Gursel, who runs the breakfast, really makes the place tops on my list. He always takes time to chat and help with your Turkish words. I can't see ever staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sallychicago
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a fantastic location if you're on your first visit to istanbul. i can't imagine better value for what you get. the rooms are clean with ensuite bathrooms and the beds are comfy. it has the character of an old-style european pension, so if you're looking for trendy go elsewhere and be prepared to pay a lot more. stay here and you'll enjoy the very friendly owner and helpful staff, the great breakfasts on the roof and a better view than the four seasons round the corner. can't recommend it enough, and the value for money is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “as be at home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Scribbi
Reviews.Content: I had right come back from Istanbul, after a really wonderful stay. The hotel is located in the centre of Sultanhamet, so it's very close to all the main sightseeings, its position is very helpful to visit the most also in a short time. My room (double) was large enough and the bathroom is good too. It was also clean, even if it seemed to be an old building. I found also wireless connection working. Having breakfast in the terrace, viewing the blu Mosque and the sea, make you starting better your day! The staff is kind, smiling, friendly and always ready to help you, to give you helpful information and to suggest you places to visit or where having meals. They also picked up us at the airport (15 euro for both me and my friend), and carried us to the airport at the departure. The hotel is cheap considering all this things... We also spent two nights in the close hotel Grand Peninsula and had a beautiful stay too. It is newer (it seemed to be just opened), and more quite , but I preferred the first hotel because of its more familiar atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “will come back”
Reviews.Author: annma85
Reviews.Content: Will definitely come back if time allows... Found this hotel through a friend who was in Istanbul in December 08. Room was cozy with excellent shower and plenty of space for the two of us. Staff was very helpful reliable and very knowledgeable. Needless to mention that the price was definitely more than right. Yes, will come back if time allows! Definitely! John and Anne-Marie

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: rvv1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two hotels. Both in the same area. This one was very quiet, despite being just a block off from the main street. We stayed in the basement, which seemed to help with the noise. Also, the staff blocks of the street to auto traffic. The location is great. You spend all your time outside the hotel, so a quiet place to rest up really helps.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: frenzee617
Reviews.Content: A college friend of mine and I stayed for 3 nights. Take advantage of the transportation to the hotel, the drivers were helpful and chatted with us and took us right to the hotel. The street it is on is very well kept, clean and inviting. The building looks like it's been remodeled and is of beautiful architecture. We stayed in a double room on the first floor which was very comfortable, and the air conditioning worked just right (we needed it, it was HOT in istanbul in august!). There is anything you want nearby: Cafes, transportation (tram), taxis to the airport, easy walk to most of the Sultanhamet attractions. The owners were very friendly, he even allowed us to use his computer for a minute to send an email, and helped us with itineraries. Breakfast is delicious and fresh. The terrace has a hammock for relaxing, and great views. For the price we paid in high season we got a DEAL. Would recommend this to anyone coming from anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicm2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for a short city break. The hotel is ideally situated, close to the main tourist attractions in Sultanamet . The rooms are clean/comfortable and the breakfast is superb. I would highly recommend this hotel and would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: HONDANSX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an amazing location just minutes walk from the blue mosque ,aya sophia,topaki etc.The staff are freindly helpfull and unintrusive.The hotel is cosy and the breakfast yogurt is out of this world.The gentleman serving breakfast isthe most freindly and informative man on turkish sights and history,The manager is very freindly and gave us a simple map to the attractions and advice was always available about directions and prices to pay for cabs.All in all a great hidden gem just the weather let us down but next year inshalla will go in the hotter months and will most deinitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “all in all - not bad!”
Reviews.Author: princessBeyoglu
Reviews.Content: The location was great, just like the breakfast. The rooms were REALLY tiny, but clean and nice. The bathroom was rather large, in comperison to the room. The service was trying to be as friendly as possible,even if they were pretending to understand you. We planed to stay 4 nights in this hotel.when we came we were asked if we wanted to spend the other 2 nigths in HANEDAN HOTEL that is just across the way.So we did,but it was a mistake!the room there was bigger but in a much worse condition. As I said,all in all this hotel is not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Very good all-round experience”
Reviews.Author: StudyTripOrganiser
Reviews.Content: We took a group (all ages) to stay at Hotel Peninsula and its sister Hanedan Hotel. We found them both excellent value: very conveniently sited, quiet and clean, terrific Turkish buffet breakfast (the yogurt is to die for), and with the friendliest management you could hope for.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: greenpeasSheffield
Reviews.Content: we (me and my partner) stayed for 4 nights, and couldn't find fault if we tried! The room was very clean and comfortable and the hotel is fantastically situated... 5 mins walk to the Blue Mosque, and Aya Sofia. Breakfast was on the top floor with great views over the Bosphoros, and we felt lucky to have such good food and company in the morning (not to mention the coffee!). The staff were very helpful and friendly, and really added something to the break. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lms8456
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Penisula for 4 nights and for the location, price and great staff, I highly recommend it. The transfers were arranged for us thru the hotel and were always prompt and friendly. They even dealt with my mini meltdown over the loss of my suitcase because of Air France, making a number of calls on my behalf and keeping me posted. Our rooms were comfy and clean plus the baths were huge! We were able to walk to the Blue Mosque and all the sites within minutes as well as a complete street of restaurants at our disposal. At night you could get a great view of the Mosque from the rooftop which must be great in the summer. I would definately stay there again and I can't wait to return to lovely Istanbul and its friendly people! Thanks again -Lyn Shepherd

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_co2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Peninsula for three nights at the end of December. The whole staff was very friendly, helpful and genuine. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, we especially enjoyed the fresh fruit and veggies in the morning. Our room was simple but clean. The location is superb, just a few minutes from Haggia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. We did hear prayer calls in the morning but they were short and therefore only added to our stay rather than being an annoyance. We actually just recommended the hotel to a friend who is going to be in Istanbul in February 09.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, good value.”
Reviews.Author: madridchiro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in great location, It's near important sites, 5 min walk from tram line, and there are plenty of good restaurants near by. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Onder, the driver is nicest guy and he's service to airport is great deal for 15 euros. The rooms are clean and small but if you pay 10 euros more for two single beds you'll get a little larger room with a table and two chairs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: johanothman
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed for six nights at the Peninsula Hotel Istanbul in December 2008. We were very pleased with every aspects of the hotel. And most importantly we were very comfortable with the kindness and warmth offered by Mr Huseyin and all the hotel staffs. i cannot think of any fault to express. The rooms- very comfortable and clean. The view from the breakfast terrace- a sight to remember and behold. The breakfast- very simple and honestly healthy and wonderful. The location - just nice. What more can one ask than to live in between the Blue Mosque and the Haya Sofia. Peninsula Hotel is just a few steps away from the Four Seasons and i can confidently say that Peninsula is just as good. What really matters is the friendly relationship that the people of Peninsula offers. Will most certainly return. We miss Peninsula and Istanbul so much..Johan Othman& Fazil (Malaysia)

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: trip38
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by one of our guide books, and I truly feel this is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in this price point. We stayed here at the beginning and again at the end of our trip to Turkey. The staff was friendly, rooms were clean and well maintained, and the homemade bread at the rooftop breakfast was amazing. I also recommend you take them up on the offer to get picked up/dropped off at the airport for an extra fee-- it is worth it. This was an overall great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Tally15
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel listed in the Lonely Planet, and it was a wonderful discovery. Not only is Peninsula located in an ideal location just a few minutes' walk from the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and the heart of Sultanahmet, it is also located in a pretty and quiet street. The combination of proximity to major tourist attractions and a peaceful setting would make one think this hotel would be charging hundreds of euros per night. But it isn't! The rooms are excellent, clean and well-provided, and the staff friendly and knowledgeable about everything in Istanbul. The views of the Hagia Sophia from the rooftop terrace as well as the Bosphorus/Sea of Marmara is one of the best sights of all of Istanbul. I heartily recommend this place to any travelers and will return here when I next visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mateluna
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel given its location in the middle of the historic area of Sultanahmet. It is a 5 minute walk from the Sultanahmet Mosque (Blue Mosque), Ayasofia and the Topkapi Palace. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with directions, phone calls to make reservations, and always made me feel at home. The rooms are very clean, and so are the bathrooms. It was nice to wake up and enjoy breakfast with the other guests in the top floor with a nice view of the Bosphorus. The nice thing about places like this, is that you can interact with the local people, help a local business, and contribute to the local economy of the place you just visited. It is also a great value, especially when you consider that there is an entrance fee to every monument in the city (and there are many!!) Next time I go to Istanbul, I would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in the hearth of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: psychoactive
Reviews.Content: This small but very well kept hotel is located in the hearth of the Sultanhamet, just a few minutes walk form Ayn Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Pro: - Great terrace, delightful breakfast served every morning (included in the price), with stunning view on the bosphorus channel. - Amazing position - Cheap rates - Lovely wooden furnished rooms, clean and peaceful. - Friendly staff - Group taxi service to the airport(s) Contra: - Location not easy to reach with your own car (taxi are allowed) Amazing stay, overall. DEFINITELY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Views as good as the Four Seasons with warmer service”
Reviews.Author: Emilwar
Reviews.Content: The view from the terrace restaurant is stunning. The breakfast is simply outstanding. The location of the Hotel is perfect too, with Aya Sofiya and the Blue Mosque just minutes away (walking).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: PG90
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a 4 night stay at Hotel Peninsula. We stayed in one of their "basic" doubles. Despite being called basic it was a good quality, decent sized, clean room, with a decent en-suite bathroom. It also had air-con and heating but we didn't need to use either. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, and there was a good selection of food laid out for the buffet-style breakfast. The hotel is in a great location, just a couple of minutes walk away from all the main attractions in Sultanahmet. Overall we were both very impressed with what we got for our money at Hotel Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull , clean warm small hotel with wonderfullpeople”
Reviews.Author: PANACO
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, very clean , quiet with wonderful warm people, very very polite, i more felt like a quest than a client. Beautiful view from the terrace , where we had our breakfast each morning, located in Sultanament very close to Haya Sofia and the blue Moscue, top capi and other sites, i have only warm memories of my stay there. Teta P. Athens Greece

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable experience”
Reviews.Author: Novacek
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel Peninsula twice this year. We were very satisfy with the hotel standard. The price is excellent. Rooms were clean and spacy enough. The hotel stays in peaceful area where many accomodation for backpackers is situated, but most of the main historical places are near (hipodrom, blue mosque, aya sophia, topkapi saray). Grand bazar and Egypt bazar are 15-20 minutes walk distance. We used the transport from/to airport offered by Peninsula hotel for both our stay. The transport is very reliable, quick and comfortable enough. But the public transport means in Istanbul are also good (reliable, clean, air conditioned), therefore I can imagine that we will go by them. The disadvantege is that they are mostly overcrowded (so the transport will not be so comfortable) and you will need more time to get to the hotel/airport. The stop of the tram (Sultanahmed) is app. 5 minutes from the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants and several shops in surroundings. The hotel has beutiful terrace, where the breakfast is served. You can see the bospor, aya sophia and blue mosque from the terrace. The breakfast is sufficient (tasteful yoghurt, marmelad, fruit, butter, eggs, bread, biscuit, etc.). The personnel is very friendly and always want to help you with a smile. The same can I say about the owner. I want to thank him by this mean (I promised him not to be lazy and write several words to this internet site, so here it is (-: ) once more for his hospitality. I DO RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL FOR SURE and I will always glad to return. Petr Novacek Czech Republic

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Willing Staff”
Reviews.Author: SouthLondonGirl2
Reviews.Content: All staff at the hotel were so friendly and helpful. Whatever we needed whether information on where to go or requesting a change of room was no trouble for them whatsoever. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Azmir
Reviews.Content: 3 of us (Malaysian) stayed in HP for 4d & 3n from 12-15/11/2008. Smooth transaction via e-mail (there's no need for credit card reservation). Even though we had terrible cranky old lady on the plane from Amman to Istanbul who kept on asking our son not to make a noise or even talk (He's 2/12 yrs old for god sake!), we were soon relieved by the driver who pick us up and Hussien who warmly welcomed us to the hotel. The standard double room was ok, everything works well, clean and tidy (Our bath room light were out on the 1st night, but they quickly change it the next morning). Fair enough for the price we paid . Everything was so near to the hotel (Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar). The staff especially Hussien Big, Hussien Small, Gusay and Arhan was so friendly and always there whenever we need them. They provide us with useful information. Not to forget, Tarchen the cat and Old Uncle Bill. We were moved to triple room on our 3rd day with the same rate and of course we enjoyed it so much. Breakfast (At the rooftoop via stairs) was the same everyday but we did not care much about it. We did bundle up for the walking we did and the breakfast is enough. Only thing is the room is not sound proof, so you have to mind the sound of peoples next door or upstairs. But normally we end up coming back to the hotel at night and go straight to bed. The transfer from hotel to airport is efficient. All in all HP did an excellent job, kudos to them and definitely we will choose to stay there whenever we are in Istanbul next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, Great hotel, Great location, Great soul..”
Reviews.Author: gusel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Peninsula is a very nice hotel, with spacy and clean beautiful rooms, as well as beautiful view from it's terrace. The most important thing, though, is the great kindness of the people, who are ready to help you and make you feel really convenient. I still miss our conversation during the breakfast time! Me and my friends recommend the hotel absolutely to everyone who want to have a brilliant stay in Istanbul! Thank you again! Cok tesekkur!!!! Greece

Reviews.Title: “Great people, location,breakfast, and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: FamilyCitytrippers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Hotel Pininsula, a great experience from start to finish. friendly e-mails, airport taxi service, and in our case 2 adjoining en suite rooms for a family of 4. The Peninsula is comfortable, and ideally located for the major sites, a great selection at breakfast helped get each day off to a good start, and a good choice of restaurants close by if you didnt want to move very far after a days sight seeing. Great service, and friendly advice from the staff, and a view from the rooftop breakfast terrace that every hotel in istanbul would wish for. Lonely Planet recommendation is spot-on. Overall I would say this has been the best city break experience we have ever had. Teenage girls loved the Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, and of course the Grand Bizaar, but be aware of tourist price in coffee bars, and at the Bizaar. Thankyou from the Housley family.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: jonoJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had originally booked to spend two nights at the Peninsula Hotel in Istanbul in October 2008. When we booked in we were warmly welcomed by Huseyin Gultekin. His staff were friendly and most helpful to us during our stay there. On Friday 17th October we booked out and took the tram to the airport for our flight on to Macedonia. Unfortunately my wallet was stolen on the tram and we could not leave Turkey. After 4 hours of battling to make ourselves understood at the Police Station, we had them call Huseyin at the Peninsula Hotel. He took a taxi to the Police Station and immediately took control of the situation, such that after an hour they took my statement and he escourted us back to his hotel. He had his staff contact our Embassy, but because it was Friday afternoon they were told to call back on Monday. Huseyin Gultkin and the Peninsula Hotel staff were fantastic. They took care of us until we were able to get travel documents and return to South Africa on 25th October. After our experience I cannot speak highly enough of the Peninsula Hotel, Huseyin Gultkin and his entire staff. When we were at our most vulnerable they were there for us in the most caring and compassionate way. I unreservedly recommend the Hotel Peninsula in Istanbul for personal and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: kbg32
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Friendly staff, convenient location. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Portlander
Reviews.Content: After 3 miserable nights at the Tulip Guesthouse (my friends had booked everything in advance, on line) just a block away, I was able to get into this lovely hotel. For the same price!! Everyone was so helpful, and the rooms were lovely. It was such a pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and a Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: missbusy
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Istanbul alone and unsure and was greeted by the one of the kindest people I have ever met. Thr hotel arranged my pick up and although the plane was two hours late he was in a great mood and very welcoming (did I mention it was 1 in the morning). Overall my stay here was fabulous. I was traveling alone in the city and felt very safe there. Huseyin was a great help.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Sevice, Location, and what a view!”
Reviews.Author: windpetal
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Istanbul and was picked up at airport. Hotel is located right in the middle of Sultanahmet. It's 5 minute walk to Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, with views of the same, from the roof and the Sea of Marmara. Rooms were spotless, warm and comfortable. Showers and toilets both worked ( I know it is expected but not always the case...) Hot water whenever desired. The owner of the hotel was knowledgable on all things to do and aware of various transportation options. He was the most helpful individual I met, while giving the feeling that the whole hotel is your home away from home. Breakfast is included, on the rooftop patio, with fresh everything you could want (Bread, tomatoes, cheesr, fruit, yoghut, jams, coffee, tea, etc). Toured a bit on the Medditterian and returned for a few more days. Felt like I was coming home. Sultanahmet is a quiet area of the city, and perfect place to branch out to all the sites. When I return to Istanbul I will definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ReptileGardensGuy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we booked our reservation we had nothing but great experiences at this hotel. Emails were answered promptly and everything promised was provided upon our arrival including the promised ride from the airport at a very reasonable price. The is great, the rooms are very clean and comfortable. We especially enjoyed the rooftop breakfast. The food was wonderful, the service superb, and the view breathtaking. Our trip was pretty open. We liked hotel so asked the manager for a room upon our return to Istanbul in 10 days. They were full but he promised to find us another hotel and was as good as his word. I even made email changes with him while we were on the road. We were sad not to be able to stay there but the accommodations he found us were next door and very nice. I would unhesitatingly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ronnieu
Reviews.Content: What can you say about the perfect fourteen-day-vacation? Our flight to New York was cancelled, and our connector to Istanbul was stuck in California because of the storms in New York. Uh-oh! But wait, an earlier flight to New York had been delayed and we got great seats, we arrived in time to have a bite to eat and find that our connector had gotten off the ground and was going to be on time. Because of a great tailwind our plane arrived an hour and a half early in Istanbul. Were we going to have to wait for our ride to the Hotel Peninsula? After all we were early. NO, as we exited customs there was a sign with our name and the Hotel Peninsula. We were led to a van and found ourselves on the rooftop patio drinking coffee within an hour of landing in Istanbul. Of course the view was even better live than it was online. See my photos at: http://photosynth.net/view.aspx?cid=13b9250e-49c3-4e84-992a-2e4f123561bf This is a new program that stitches photos together to create a 3D view. Enjoy! Or see our vacation photos at: http://picasaweb.google.com/home?hl=en&tab=wq Our room was the penthouse and we really expected a very small room based on some of the comments online. But the room was a good size with a small make-up table, a wardrobe, two nightstands, two chairs with a table in-between and a bed large enough for me (Iâ€™m 6â€™ 3â€�). The bathroom was small, but bigger than a cruise-ship bathroom, with a large shower with plenty of hot water and the best water pressure that Iâ€™ve ever had in a hotel â€“ invigorating! The staff was great and spoke great English. They were able to answer most of our questions or send us to someone who could. The location is perfect; itâ€™s one block south of the Four Seasons Hotel and about a $1000.00 cheaper a night and the Peninsula includes breakfast. Breakfast always included service with a smile and great fresh food. There were some small downsides to the fourth-floor location; coming back after a day of walking up and down the hills of Istanbul made the four flights of stairs look like Mt. Everest on some days. But once we were in the room, we could walk right out our door and have the most wonderful view of Istanbul from the patio. And in the morning we could walk right out and have breakfast on the patio. You could hear when people were on the upper patio, but there were no late night partiers to disturb our rest. The minaret at the rear of the hotel is loud but after a few days we either slept right through or used it for our morning wake-up call. I donâ€™t think that there is anywhere in Istanbul where youâ€™re not going to hear the â€œCall to Prayer.â€� Usually we were up by breakfast time so we werenâ€™t disturbed by the breakfast crowd on the patio and we only had steps to go to get our coffee or tea. Our transport back to the airport went just as smoothly as our pick-up. We wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay here again whenever weâ€™re in Istanbul; it was a great experience and a great value. Ron & Sue

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service at the Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: Meme-Sheena
Reviews.Content: This a a lovely small hotel situated in a quiet cul de sac within walking distance of the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque yet close to the parts of Sultanahmet where ordinary folk live. The evocative call to prayer from the numerous mosques in the vicinity mingles with the sounds of children playing in the streets below and women sitting on doorsteps chatting about the joys and tribulations of everyday life. The hotel must be the friendliest we have encountered. The staff will do anything to please you - nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are simple, clean and comfortable. You start the day with an enjoyable, healthy breakfast of fruit, cheese, eggs and bread on the roof terrace watching boats of all shapes and sizes going about their business on the Sea of Marmaris. The hotel provides a convenient base for sightseeing in Sultanahmet itself and further afield in Istanbul. What's more it is affordable. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “The review is long overdue!”
Reviews.Author: D1223chicago
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is one of the most beautiful places I've ever travelled to. One of the things that made our trip so fantastic was our stay at the Peninsula Hotel. Hotel Peninsula is not just a hotel; it is an experience. The cheerful greetings from the hoteliers every morning and night, made you feel like you were right at home. They are always very helpful and speak English well. They offer a wonderful Turkish breakfast on the roof of the hotel overlooking the Bosphorus and Haya Sofya, The rates were very reasonable. And if location is a concern, this hotel is smack dab in the middle of Sultanhemet; only minutes away to all the historical sites! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. If ever I get the chance to go back to Istanbul, I would definitely stay at the Peninsula Hotel or their sister hotel, The Hanedan which is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “The sweetest hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lennita2
Reviews.Content: Cozy hotel in good location. Clean rooms and nice staff. Great home-made breakfast on the roof with a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely well priced and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: rgdCambridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this hotel in the middle of March 2008. The hotel is about two minutes' walk from the Blue Mosque and is therefore very close to the main sights in Istanbul. The staff were very friendly and gave us lots of information about the city. The room was well-decorated, clean, and the bathroom was pleasant. Breakfast was tasty and filling - you can eat on the roof-top terrace, which has a good view out to sea. The only down-side to the hotel was the loud call-to-prayer in the morning, and general noise levels. However I imagine most of the hotels in this area would have the same problems. If we return to Istanbul we will stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blue-delphinium
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Peninsula for 5 nights in June--at the beginning and end of our two-week tour of Turkey. This was one of the best hotels we stayed at in Turkey. What makes this hotel wonderful is the perfect location (5 min. walk to major attractions, tram station, restaurants), nice, clean rooms, and delicious breakfast (the highlight for me were the two types of homemade jams and yogurt). The best part of the hotel was the friendly and kind staff, especially Huseyin. When we returned to the hotel after touring other parts of Turkey, he upgraded us to a beautiful room with a great view. It was such a wonderful treat! We were really glad we chose to stay here for our first visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Reddomj
Reviews.Content: Hotel Peninsula is in a great location with a great terrace view of the water. It was clean, safe and friendly. We stayed two nights and then when we found ourselves without a reservation later in our trip, the staff from Hotel Peninsula helped us find another hotel near there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: rh1home
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at Hotel Peninsular for 6 nights at the end of May 2008. We had 2 interconnected rooms which are perfect for us. The price is the main attraction for us when we booked (85 euros per night for both rooms!). It turns out the location is also very good. Especially if you plan to walk down to Eminonu a lot, since the hotel is on the Hagia Sophia side and not the Blue Mosque side. There are grocery nearly and laudry also. Our rooms are basic but clean. Our beds are all comfortable. The air conditioners work but took us a little bit to figure out how to work them. We had no problem with getting hot water in the shower during our stay. There are noise from the outside, even at night time, if you leave the windows open. We noticed it but were not disturbed by it. Breakfast is served on the terrace. We enjoyed the setting and the views. The top level has 3 hammocks which our kids like and nice view of the Sea of Mamaris, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. A typical breakfast is served. There are tomatoes, olives, cucumber, white cheese and fresh bread. Hard boiled eggs, fresh made yogurt. Sometimes they serve fresh apricots too. The pictures you see here are quite representative of the hotel. We'll definitely consider staying at Hotel Penisular again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiger_in_Dubai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days in June with my husband in a sea-view room. Overall, we thought the hotel (which is more like a pension really) provided great value for money. Sure, rooms are relatively small & it's not salubrious, but the location, the terrace & the price made up for it. Positives: - Great location, right in the middle of Sultanhamet, but off the main street (so no street noise) - Brilliant roof terrace, with chairs, tables, hammocks and great views of the sea - Nice Turkish breakfast - Very friendly & helpful owners - Reasonably priced hotel pick up Negatives - there's a speaker for the mosque a few metres away from the hotel. This is not unique to this hotel as all of the places in this area of Istanbul are within earshot of mosques. If you aren't used to mosques, bring ear-plugs. - some guests in the lower rooms complained of small rooms & dodgy beds. We were in the room on the top floor, which had a comfortable bed, great view & no noise (apart from minor kitchen noises in the morning as the kitchen is on the top of the hotel) - several flights of narrow stairs. No problem for us, but could be a problem for older guests or those with heavy suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: inecekvar
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by chance here on Trip Advisor. After reading reviews, looking at pictures, and going to the hotel's own web page, I decided to try it since the other hotels I have stayed at before were too expensive in the summer. The nightmare of delayed flights, missed connections, and lost luggage were quickly forgotten as I settled into the Peninsula. The owner/manager HÃ¼seyin, and all the staff made for a very pleasant stay. It was more like staying at a relative's home than a hotel. The atmosphere very laid back, friendly, charming. The room was larger than in my previous, more expensive hotel. The bed comfortable. Reliable hot water at all hours. Good working A/C. Bathroom also roomier than I have seen in many other hotels. The streets right outside the hotel is full of restaurants/cafes all open late, at least in the summer. At least 3 mini marts within a block or two are an added convenience. Location is perfect, away from the main areas yet an easy quick walk to all the attractions as well as the tram. The rooms have no TV's. The wi-fi internet is free but only available in the hotel lobby which at first I thought it might be a nuisance, but it turned out to be a very enjoyable experience sitting with the staff and other guests while using my laptop. Also, friends, family, staff from hotels across the street come in and out to make you feel part of an extended family. I had to change my booking/times a few times and the owner was very accomodating and always answering e-mails quickly. My airport pickup was timely even though my flight was delayed 5 hours. In summation, a great value for the money. Friendly, caring staff and an owner who appears to care for his business as well as for his guests. I loved Istanbul and travel there often and next visit I will definetely give Mr. HÃ¼seyin a call.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: Maija21
Reviews.Content: In March this year I travelled again to Istanbul to spend four spring days there. It wasn't difficult to search for hotel where to stay, Hotel Peninsula was the self-evident choice! After my last visit they restored the hotel beuatifully and stylishly, not forgetting Turkish atmosphere! My room and bathroom were spacious and very clean. The breakfast was delicious and substantial for all day walking aroud Istanbul. Specially the home made yoghurt with mamelade; its the best I have ever tasted when travelling aroud. Old mosque beside the hotel is waking up very early with praying call, but I must say that after first morning I never heard it again. And Istanbul wasn't Istanbul without five times in a day repeating praying calls! The staff was helpful and friendly again! I call sincearly recommend Hotel Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice people and Value on the money”
Reviews.Author: Familia_hos
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel actually by browsing in tripadvisor, and I decided to stay there because of the good review from the fellows who wrote the reviews here. I must say from the beginning that I had a doubt about the booking system since they do not have SSL for credit card, so I didn't want to give my CC information through email, and apart from that I was afraid that they won't keep the booking for me if I didn't give any warranty. But it turned out really good. Huseyn, the guy who takes care of the hotel, was really helpful, although I kept changing the booking plan, they still kept my booking although I didn't give my CC detail. They also arranged the pick up transport with only 15 EUR (for 2 persons). The room with double bed costs 49 EUR/night, and it's already including the breakfast for 2. The room is quiet small, but if you are staying in main area of the city, then you could understand why. The bed is also quiet small, my husband is 185 cm, and he couldn't really fit on the bed. I got the first room at the hotel and it's behind the receptionist. It was quiet noisy during the day, but anyway we didn't stay much at the hotel and preferred to wander around the city, so it didn't bother much. Everything is clean so don't worry about the hygiene. In the morning, the breakfast was served on the roof, so we can enjoy the view of Blue mosque, Aya Sofia and also the sea. Thing that i really appreciate the most is the hospitality of the guys there. Huseyin indeed is very helpful and friendly to all of us who were staying there. It's definitely a great place to stay, value of the money, and you'll have the host that always makes sure you'll get only good memory from staying there. I am sure most of the guests agree with this. Btw, I was smiling when I checked in and saw Garfield....I remember her from one of the fellows that posted her picture here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find - Warm, Charming, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sputnitsa
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place that's centrally located in Sultanahmet, close to the sights and featuring Turkish charm and a personalized welcome, Hotel Peninsula can be your perfect home away from home. It's newly renovated, it's pretty and quaint, the rooms are comfortable and tastefully decorated. The breakfast room is a charmer... and the traditional low breakfast tables are a gem... And then there's also the terrace for warm mornings. My first morning was spent comfortably relaxing and chatting with another guest and Gursel, the wonderfully warm and enchanting cook/breakfast room attendant. I felt I could come back a million times. The view is simply lovely (a film crew was checking out the place one time I was there), the breakfast is simple but tasty. And the atmosphere just perfect. We chose this hotel not only because of the great value and location (EVERYTHING is near the hotel), but also because I'd read that the staff was friendly... It really was a friendly, warm stay... (And not in the overbearing way that some Sultanahmet places can have.) The staff really does take care of its guests, and some have kept returning for years. I highly recommend staying at Hotel Peninsula, whether you're staying one night or indefinitely :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: byerleysam
Reviews.Content: Located right by the Blue Mosque, Toakpi Palace and Aya Sofia. Staff are friendly but have a habit of quoting all prices in euro (when I was here they were supposed to be working with the new turkish lira), they also have a constant stream of conversations from their front door (which was above my room) mainly with the Handehan hotel opposite. I had requested a quiet room but it's not a very quiet hotel - i actually had a room with an ajoining door to the next door room. There are no TVs in the rooms or kettle. The hotel is fresh and homey. The breakfast is good and the upper terrace has amazing views over the Bosphorous, Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ludikristen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Sultanahmet, about 3 mins walk from Aya Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and the tram line. It's about 10 mins walk to Topkapi Palace, the archeological museum complex and the Grand Bazaar. Who could ask for a better location?! The single room I had was a bit small but it was clean and comfortable. I then booked to stay a few more days when I came back from a tour, and was in a bigger room. Huseyin, the owner, is a real sweety. He has good English, is really helpful and has lots of advice about the attractions in Istanbul. Breakfast is on the roof (either inside or outside) and the breakfast waiter is also really sweet. His English isn't so good but that doesn't stop him being quite partial to talking about deep philosophical issues to anyone who has an interest in the subject. Huseyin also owns Hotel Hanedan across the road so if Peninsula is booked out, try there. Overall, I would absolutely recommend Hotel Peninsula. Kristen

Reviews.Title: “Good value room”
Reviews.Author: janeyangel
Reviews.Content: Found this on trip adviser and i have to say we were very please with this hotel,tradational turkish breakfast which my husband loved being turkish. Set in the heart of the touristical area. Rooms were good size and were very clean which were serviced every day, staff were polite and friendly , my only moan was there was no kettle in the room. But i would go back again very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Inviting with great people - A great find!”
Reviews.Author: TheGoodJody
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Peninsula was the perfect place and a rare find! And we found it on Trip Advisor! The hotel arranged my pick up from the airport for a great rate and even allowed my friend who was arriving early (at 7:30 am) to check-in upon arrival. Although my flight was delayed 5 hours, the driver waited in the airport the entire time and greeted me with a smile. When I arrived at the hotel, Huseyin, the owner, gave me a warm welcome and even provided us with a restaurant recommendation (which turned out to be fabulous!). He made sure we woke up at 4:30 am the next morning and sat with us while we waited for our ride back to the airport to head out to Cappadocia. The service truly was remarkable! The rooms were clean and the breakfast room was quaint. Unfortunately I did not have time to enjoy their breakfast because we had to leave so early. The only thing the may turn some off is the call to prayer at 5 am. But there is always the street side of the hotel where you supposedly can't hear it. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Peninsula
HotelInfo.Address: Adliye Sokak 6 | Off Akbiyik Cad, Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
